review_text:
KathNiel's G.O.A.T movie!: I don't usually go watch local films, but KathNiel just have that thing that makes me not want to miss it every single time (I always watch on it's first day too.) lol

So here's my non-biased review. I will try to be as objective as possible. For someone who appreciate movies a whole lot, it is such a hard thing to please me and my siblings when it comes to movies. I was a bit hesitant before watching the movie, rom-com-drama movies are not really my type.

This movie, went beyond my expectations. The cinematography wasn't as great compared to their Crazy Beautiful You movie, but nonetheless, it really went beyond expectations. I never expected it to be as creative and dynamic because of the simple setting and story line, but it was unbelievably quite on par with CBY. Kudos to the team for that!

Story wise, it was that kind of movie which is really simple and not as complicated as others but it really brought out the feels. I specifically loved the beginning part the most! It's not common for Filipino movies to start that way but it did! Not gonna spoil the scenes though. Gonna leave it all to you to find out how beautifully catching it was. Another thing to note, was the transition to each and every scene, the voice overs and the story flow. It's meticulously put together that you'll be hooked the whole time you're watching the movie. The dynamics was there too, will sound cliche but it was a roller coaster of feelings. When you think you're through all the heavy scenes, and can feel the whole cinema audience sharing that light feeling, they'll hit you with the feels again.

To the couple, Kathryn and Daniel, they were really the one who brought the movie to life. Unlike, Barcelona: A Love Untold, we saw how great of a supporting actor Joshua is and for me, he was one of the actors who brought the movie to life. In here, it was all them. Not discrediting other actors, they all did a good job. Darren is a revelation, the kid is a multi-talented person. We can't really say anything about Miss Jean Garcia cause she really is a legend. Other cast's acting were quite bland but it was still a good one. Joross and another actor's cameo was also on point. For those who never had a relationship like me, Juan Miguel Severo and Ria Atayde was the most relatable one. They really showed what friends do, it was real, really genuine. Back to KathNiel, I really feel like this is their best movie yet. Kathryn was on her zone, she really owned this one. She literally shone her, she really showed her vulnerability and it's super far from when she was starting and her teen movies. We really saw Kathryn, not Kathryn with Daniel but Kathryn. Kathryn herself. Daniel is a natural, we all know that. I can't even explain how great of an actor he is, whenever he accepts a character, you won't see a trace of the Daniel Padilla in real life but he really gets into the character and owns it. He was the best Primo just as Kathryn was the best George. They really owned this one.

Direk Cathy showed us again why she is a blockbuster director. She is a legend. Maybe not indie wise, cause that's not her forte. But we can always trust Direk Cathy to bring out all the emotions, may it be tears of both joy and pain, all the laughs and all the frustrations.

Rated it 8 because there will always be room for improvement for all the actors and the movie itself, but overall it is a really great one. A must-watch!

TOUCHING AND UNIQUE: As a non-fan of the usual romantic Filipino films, especially those starring love teams, "The Hows of Us" is a unique film thanks to the set up. It's also nice to see a nice twist to the what's essentially the same formula.

7/10 rating will do: I watched this movie out of curiousity... 'cos my friends keep on telling me its a nice movie... well, not bad, the story is good. What I only don't like is the "Live in" concept.. it tells youth nowadays to it's okay to live together without marriage for if you two don't click living together..let go and leave each other.. but if you click that's it be with each other... Realization nowadays, Filipino youth seems forget the culture, the values... anyway, congrats to kath and daniel, great improvement in their acting...it won't surprise me if you two brag the Best / Promising Actress and Actor of the year..

direk cathy is superb in showing us the ups and downs of a long term relationship.: This movie is the 'one more chance' of this generation. very relatable. i agree that there's nothing new in the storyline simply because couples these days still struggle with the same issues like all other couples from before.
I dont understand Phillipino language so...: Good movie, even tho I didn't understand the language still this movie didn't bored me at all this movie is very cute and lovely ^-^

8/10: For a Filipino Film I'll give it a score of 9/10 It is one of the best RomComs in the Philippines ever!

But if you stack it against Hollywood movies. a score of 7/10 would suffice.

Acting Lead Actors: 10/10, they portrayed it masterfully. Supporting Cast: 6/10, could have casted a better "Yohan", they gave him a lot of screentime and his portrayal is lacking. The cousin and friends of Primo needs more workshops. George's friends were the bright spots.

Story/Dialogue The plot is simple and direct to the point. It somewhat dragged when they went to Amsterdam. Dialogue was good 7/10

Direction/Cinematography CGM is one of the best when it comes to RomComs here in the Philippines. 9/10

As of Sept 7 it has 404M php gross, and its only been up for 10 days.

PS: To the other reviewees, please be fair, don't bring your Crab mentality here.
Personal review.: QuiteBeautiful siya medyo kailangan lang nila ng workshops pa esp. Daniel

Not supposed to be 1 STAR, but........: Ok ladies and gentlemen, I might get hate comments on this but this is my review on this movie.

First, the only reason I had the urge to create an account on IMDB is because of the overrated reviews this movie has gotten. On top of that, this film became the BOX OFFICE FILM of the Philippines of all time! (So, arousing my curiosity, I took the time to watch).

The material of this film was alright. Nothing extra special to be honest. The usual romcom pinoy film. In my opinion (no hate to Kathniel), it could've been better if someone better portrayed their characters.

Seriously, who would live in the same house and put a division using a tape? Like, cmon, seriously?

There were okay moments, but seriously Filipinos who went gaga on this movie need to re-evaluate yourselves. I'm not even hard to please.

I would rate this film a 4/10 or 5. I gave it 1 STAR to lower down its overrated reviews from other people like giving it 10?? and their best movie of all time? Jeez.

Best movie ever!!!: 10 is not enough to rate this movie it should be ughh 101. This is the best movie of 2018 literally! Will give u a lot of realizations. This movie didn't GRADED A for no reason! So watch the talk of the town movie and don't forget to bring tissue. KathNiel and THOU team ay maghahakot ng awards!

Good movie but not too commercialized: Neither I am a Kathniel fan nor hater, this is just an honest review (for me).

Before I watched the movie, I made sure that I've had checked social media on everyone's take on this film. Honestly, I was convinced to watch it. As I enter the movie house, my eyes were on point to each scene. During the first part, I totally enjoyed it. Everything was so realistic and on-point. But as the movie runs, it made me bored already. The scenes were all over already. I must say, Can't help falling in love was their "most matured film."

Did I leave the movie house feeling heavy-hearted? No Did I leave the movie house happy? Yes, but just to give my thoughts about it. Will I watch it again? Maybe if I want to see what part I may have missed. Was it worth the money? 280 pesos is not bad but I left the movie house thinking I should have watched other local movies that will really make my feelings satisfied.

Let's just be honest here, do you think this was their best movie so far? I don't think so. To be honest, I think I was just convinced by lots of fans commenting that this was their movie ever.

Lesson Learned: Do not believe in what you see or hear.

Best Movie of Kathniel: A story everyone can relate to. Kathryn was at her best in this movie and she deserves all the praises she is receiving from those who watched the movie. Daniel a natural charmer and his comedic timing was impeccable. Kudos to director CGM for bringing out the best in them!
Must watched...: Superb....the best....movie of the year...touching and may aral...
Story and Characters are cliche and boring: Acting is substandard. Story is utterly boring. Very cliche characters and story. Ending is rushed.
10/10!: Cathy garcia molina and kathniel definitely outdid themselves with this movie! superb acting, cinematography, direction, and lines. A MUST WATCH!

Don't believe the 10/10 reviews here: First half of the movie was good, promising... can't say the same for the rest.

I felt like her struggle during the relationship wasn't acknowledged enough when he came back. Then the scene where we're told of what his life was after he left her felt lacking. Sure, he experienced real life, but that doesn't change how much of an a-hole he was to her. I still thought that's not enough for a reconcilliation at this point. But, of course, you see her starting to give into him. Pathetic.

Then there's the letter. Such a corny literal piece of garbage. People who fall for that, are the same people who fall for heart emojis.
relatable movie: Great story and acting from the cast, especially from the female lead. She made me emphatize with her.
Must see lovestory movie: The best ever movie of KathNiel. Mixed emotion, i cried, and the sametime kilig factor

Good production, Disappointing story: The cinematography is good and can be improved. Actors are not that bad. However, the story does not make it worth-watching. The male lead character doesn't seem to have changed that much when he returned. If I were the female lead, I would never choose such man. The good reviews maybe a bit biased because of the large fandom of KathNiel.

REAL, HONEST REVIEW FOR #TheHowsOfUs. "IN THEIR MOST FINEST PERFORMANCE/MOVIE OF ALL": Watched it exactly on it's showing date in cinemas (August 29, 2018) and I can say that the audience really missed KathNiel on big screen/cinemas! Sold-out screenings, long lines, etc.

Review for the movie: This is going to be the last tandem movie of KathNiel together with Filipino's Blockbuster Director, Cathy Garcia-Molina. And they really did impress us viewers with their last movie together! The movie is a little bit cliche as you can say but atleast, it has something new to offer for the viewers. Direk Cathy indeed put up her best for the movie turned out to be beautifully scripted, it is by far expectation acting coming from all of the cast especially Kathryn Bernardo (this is her most amazing character/acting as she portrays "George"). KathNiel didn't failed us on each of their movie. Perhaps, they both keep on leveling up in their craft of acting or as a love team or maybe a partners in real life (hehe).

THE MOST TALKED-ABOUT AND MUST WATCH MOVIE OF 2018. YOU SHOULD NOT MISS IT! ;)

Half baked poetry!: Exactly this is half baked. The first half is poetic, the agony of the heroine is well-portrayed. When in the second half of the movie the narrator tries to solve the puzzles, the story falls flat that you honestly pity yourself for watching the thoughtless work!
Beautiful story: Sobrang gandaaaa. Nakakaiyak sobrang galing ng kathniel
BEST MOVIE EVER: This is great movie, may matutunan ka talaga, and also this is the best of Kathryn Bernardo. You should watch it. Sulit ang bayad nyo. PROMiSe.

Just fine but: This movie is just fine. Not boring, some scenes are realistic but I don't understand the hype at all, what's so special about the movie ? It would have been better if they didn't end up together like the dude was such a red flag then they would tryna change him which is the whole point of the story and make them come back together, lol chiche. They really make everything a happy ending like I haven't seen a movie of kathniel that has a sad ending at least this one would be better if they didn't end up together again at the end. I'm only rating it a 3 because of their acting, they deserve that.

Obviously the best romance movie of Star Cinema this recent years: I must say the Filipino movies are really improving. Our films can give us so more genres in three weeks. This The Hows Of Us is the best romance movie. 10/10.

The Best Movie of 2018 and Best KathNiel Movie of all time.: 10/10

Everything in the movie is at its best.

Do not believe the poor rating and review given by other reviewers, they are just part of other fandoms who wants to bring the movie down.

See it for yourself, for you to know that indeed, this is the Best Movie of 2018.

REALISTIC: This movie is great. It gives you the feels of loving someone. I have a boyfriend and we're already on our 3rd year. Seeing this movie will help you realize things that will help you improve your relationship. If your love is true, it will make you a better person.
Added to Classic Filipino Movies: Watched it 3 times and still can't get enough of it. Kathryn and Daniel are very natural and Kit Thompson is such a revelation. This is the best movie 2018 for me.
THE BEST: On of the best filipino movies i saw. grabe magpaiyak, daming realizations

Love it..: Haters are everywhere here.. :)))

The movie shows how versatile Kathryn is..
The best movie!: The best movie of all time. Simple plotwise but emotion wise. Your time was worth it to watch thos movei.

Definitely a must watch film!: The story and concept is simple which makes this film more interesting and remarkable in a way. How? Then watch it!

Kidding aside, the actors were great, ang galing ni Kathryn and Daniel! My God, best actress ang acting ni Kathryn dito and yung ibang cast nagbeblend in sa kanila. I love Miko! (Beki friend of Kath in the film). The scenes and lines were very relatable. Believe it or not, yung katabi kong guy na may kasamang gf umiyak nung pa-end na yung movie.

The 'hugot' of this film is not just the typical na hugot pagibig. It's a hugot about life, love, your family and friends.

If given a chance at may magaya, for sure panuodin ko ulit! Sobrang worth it sa ticket prize na 295 (ang mahal bes). I hope a lot of people will be able to watch this film. Pwede sa barkada, sa magjowa, sa buong pamilya (makakarelate si inay at itay). Go na bes, watch na. You won't regret it! Promise!

KATHNIEL'S "THE HOWS OF US" , A BLOCKBUSTER MOVIE INDEED!: #TheHowsOfUs The 9th Movie-team up of KathNiel and their second movie with the blockbuster director, Cathy Garcia-Molina (after She's Dating The Gangster) and may I just say that they keep on leveling up with their acting skills as a love team or as individual actor/s.

*Beautifully scripted *Cinematography, Wise! *Simple plot and story but will definitely hit you hard and after it will give you a lot of realizations about relationship/s. *At syempre, TATAK CATHY GARCIA-MOLINA yan eh!

#THOU is their best movie of all! (though lahat naman ng movie nila is maganda). All of the cast has brought such a great performance but Kathryn Bernardo? She really nailed it! She brings a Award-Winning worthy acting as she portrays "George." Also, what I like about the movie is that it is very relatable in all aspects (relationship, family, self)

! If in year 2000, we have Popoy and Basha. In year 2018, we have Primo and George. You should not miss such great movie like The Hows Of Us! THE BEST TAGALOG MOVIE OF 2018 so far.
PAINFUL BUT HOPEFUL: This movie will break and fix you. A must watch movie

A reflection of the line, How do we save us: The question "how do we save us?" does not only pertain to failing relationships. It is also a question you would ask yourself when you are at a crossroad. If you are at a point in life where you needed to choose between pursuing your passion or settling for practicality. It is a question of "how do I save myself?" from my own failed expectations when things don't work out to how I planned it. How do I save myself from the self pity? the self hate? How can I admit to myself that maybe, just maybe this isn't what's meant for me?

Shadows: I'm gonna keep it short and simple. After watching the movie, it will leave you with questions and answers you didn't know is with you. The shadows by the sidelines waiting for you to open that urn and welcome yourself by setting you free. Finally. Thank you The Hows of Us.
Kdrama fan liked it: As a fan of Kdramas. I will surely recommend this movie. A must watch. You will feel a roller coaster emotion.
Worth watching: Honestly, it's one of those movies that you would not get tired of watching. Very endearing and real. Would recommend
The Hows Of Us: For me the movie is the best movie of 2018,the story,the acting,the direction,the cinematography,is the best,it was the best movie of the year.

Dont believe the bad reviews: I watched this together with my family. And it's worth it. This movie is an art. You could really see the effort of each actor and staff in every scene. This is not a typical love story just like what others say. This is uniquely made. Pinag isipan talaga to let the audience feel the kirot at kilig that makes the movie relatable.

A MUST WATCH FILM: This movie really hits me home. Such superb acting and the film over all was very real, it's very authentic it feels like I was watching a movie based on a true to life events. It feels like Primo and George really existed. It made me cry, laugh, feel being heartbrokened, fell in love again and became whole. Please do watch in the cinemas near you. You won't regret it. If your status is in a relationship, moving on or never had been in one. You can get lessons and tips about LOVE. Worth evey penny!
THE BEST KN MOVIE: Ang galing galing!! hands down sa mga actors sa movie na to. sobrang worth it panoorin
The Best Movie of 2018!: The acting of Kathniel in this movie is SUPERB! They deserve the best actor and best actress award, Direk Cathy never fail give us quality films with heartfelt message.

THE BEST LOCAL FILM OF 2018: THE BEST LOVE AND LIFE STORY FOR EVERY FILIPINO AND FILIPINO BY HEART. THE BEST OF KATHNIEL, THE BEST OF CATHY GARCIA MOLINA, THE BEST OF KATHRYN BERNARDO. KATHRYN BERNARDO THE NEW BEST ACTRESS OF ALL TIME

quality film: This was Graded A by cinema evaluators. hence I watched it so I can attest how good this movie was. KATHNIEL is undeniably has massive fanbase that cinema owners/malls had to open more cinema theaters to accomodate moviegoers. 420 cinemas nationwide to date... KATHNIEL, the King and Queen of Philippine Movie this 2018!!

BEST KATHNIEL MOVIE: This is not your typical Filipino lovestory. THOU will make you believe in love again, in taking risks, and fighting for the one whom you think is worth it. It will give you a roller coaster of emotion. It is worth every penny. The casts played their role very well and you can definitely relate from each character.
Reality: I love this movie. I mean it tacles the everyday life of couples. It strengthens bond between couples. Highly recommended this film

REALISTIC: Superb acting
Amazing cinematography
Script on point
Simple but realistic plot
The right balance of romance, drama and comedy
Characters are relatable because for sure at one point in our lives we became one of those characters


PS: Please don't believe some of the 1 star ratings here because it mostly came from different group of salty fandoms lmao. Anyways enjoy watching thou!

Beatifully executed and Strong connection to reality: This movie is beautifully written and executed. The actors delivered amazingly to the point you will be thinking as if you are watching a reality.

THIS MOVIE IS A MASTERPIECE: Every line is a Tagline, a thought to fonder. Things in the house are small things as it may seem but the relevance is so big that I can't believe that a piece of yellow paper can make me cry a river. Not just "ThenHowsOfUs its alao "TheHouseOfUs"
Best romance movie: Very real, very touching. We learn how do we save a relationship.

Beautifully Photographed: Raw. Natural. Sweet. Wholesome. Lasting. This movie is a masterpiece! The whole run of the story is well executed. Each character portrayal especially the lead actors are beyond amazing. KathNiel effortlessly delivered their natural sweetness and love for each other. It gives impact that lasts.

Movie of the Year Material: I'll give this movie a 10/10.

Realistic. Honest. Raw. Faithful to the storyline. No unnecessary sub-plots. Simple. The actors and their superb acting gave us the rollercoaster ride of emotions. One minute you're laughing and next you're sobbing and then it'll make you realize things you had done in the past.

Kudos!

WHOLE PACKAGE!: This movie is a whole package!! The cinematography, scripts, acting, actors, musics and everything in it is just superb!! Surely, this movie is a must watch and the best movie of 2018! Swear, your money won't go to waste. After the movie, you'll be left dumbfounded. No words to utter. You can only hear sobbing. Watch it and testify!

Thou shall watch THOU.

Simple. Raw. Funny. Painful. and Romantic: Simple because most of the audience can relate. The person behind it doesn't need to complicate things to create this wonderful film. Acting is Superb. You feel the emotion and the pain of the main actress. Every breath you hear pinches your heart and then your tear starts to fall. Kathryn and Daniel were really into Rom-Com movies. I love how the humor unexpectedly surprises you every scene and I can hear genuine laughs from the audience. Painful. Yea it's painful. Romantic. Kathniel is natural. Unbeatable.

Not your typical Filipino Rom-com: A strong and raw depiction of a struggling relationship.

No, this is not an epic star-crossed lovers nor a cute campus crush story. A simple story of a couple facing the ups and downs of a long-term relationship. Facing the challenges caused by their own passion and dreams.

There are heavy scenes that you'll feel the weight and tension(fav:first 25 minutes) while there are also light ones that will bring a smile on your face.(the house division sequence)

The characters are likable with strong characterization...thanks to the cast's performance and the direction. The dialogue never felt out of place.

Great cinematography and I love the use of classic songs.

Watch it and you won't be disappointed.(tissues.just in case)

A really educational movie on relationships!: I can back to IMDB to write after long years after watching this movie! The ending is emotionally strong, be sure to grab some tissues... I could connect to the feelings of the guy... one who sees... who feels... but can not do any better... when you start losing consideration for yourself! It is tough! Really tough to cope with...

But this movie is a definitely must watch for every young adult! There is a thing or two to learn from it... I was happy to have watched this :) Feelings are one and only!

A great movie where you can get life lessons: Kathryn Bernardoand George and Daniel Padilla as primo are schoolmates who fall in love.George preparing to get into medical school and Primo a musician waiting for his band to hit it big. Together, in a house they inherited from George's grand aunt, they dream of great success and promise to support each other no matter what.But what happens when the dream of success doesn't come for one of them. Primo doesn't get the big break he's been working for and turns into a difficult and arrogant artist who can't even help with the bills. Faithful George stays true to her promise to support Primo through it all.that is until she reaches her breaking point and gives up. Dejected, Primo walks out and does not look back.Years later, Primo comes back and changed man. And Geogre still pursuing her dream. Primo want to George back to his life but Goerge won't repeat or continue her life with Primo because she remember the days when she choose Primo than her dream and that ruin everything for her. But the days and months past George realize that she still love Primo because all of a sudden Primo tries to do everything for George but George did not see that effort.until George found the letter from Primo on the day that she decided to leave Primo. The letter make George realized that she still have love Primo. In the end they both back and leave together.The Hows Of Us is a moving story about the ups and downs of real-life relationships.

Superb performance!: Love this movie! Got to give it to Kathryn and Daniel!! Kathryn is superb in this movie! She can move you! Her emotions!! Wow!! You can actually feel it! Daniel is a natural! Thumbs up!!
inch resting,,,,,,
lowkey wishing they didnt end up together again but i am a bitch for these kind of movies soo
Ano yon

There used to be a time when the powers-at-be were trying to convince people that Daniel Padilla was cool, casting him as the broody teenage bad-boy that had to be won over by the steely determination of his good-girl paramour Kathryn Bernardo. But he's not cool, at least in that way. He's got a big goofy smile, a friendly presence, and an earnestness that gives his characters surprising vulnerability. His growth as an actor largely involves him being comfortable up on screen, being some version of himself that's closer to who he really is.And this leads to the best bits of this movie, which almost seem to happen in a vacuum of narrative. It doesn't matter what came before or what might happen after. In the moment, it just looks like these two kids are enjoying themselves. Kathryn Bernardo hasn't quite kept up with Padilla's development, her performances getting a little stiffer as she gets older, but their clear affection for one another smooths out a lot of these scenes.But these moments don't actually exist in a vacuum. There's a movie around it, and like so many local big romcoms, there are just too many things going on. All the classic formula markers are there, too: some sort of medical problem, some parental issues and a whole bunch of characters that exist purely to tell the leads what they're supposed to be feeling. The movie stretches into two hours with the added weight of these rote elements, and by the time they fly off to some foreign land, it kind of feels like an entirely different movie. It shifts focus completely, and starts filling in even more backstory through yet another character that just says everything outright.The story they end up telling is actually pretty simple, but there are just so many other things that crowd out the much more affecting core of this story: two people still clearly in love with each other, just trying to overcome the hurt that also still exists between them. In bits, in moments, the two kind of make that work. But the movie itself feels so caught up in the norms of their genre to just let the leads take the lead.

HEARTFELT. This film presents a distinct, powerfully affecting kind of love story to prove that the standard CGM formula has still some unique perspectives to spin and explore. Here’s a mind dump (with little spoilers) rendered in the same fashion as the film’s break-build narrative, starting off with negatives (baka awayin ako ng fans, lol), wrapping up with positives. 1. The opening voiceovers are certainly moving but seem lengthier than necessary. I hate that I feel like I’m being spoon-fed.2. Daniel’s character is rather poorly developed. And the choice to reveal his backstory through another character’s verbose lines is quite a disappointment. 3. I am totally confused about (what I think is) the turning point where Primo has to leave because that’s obviously what he is asked to, then is instantly being chased by George afterwards. There is no question about Kathryn’s acting, but seriously I’m like, “Girl, why are you crying? Pinaalis mo ‘di ba?” And when he returns, she says something like “That’s not what I actually meant because I was just tired, and that I wanted you to fight for us that night.” Ang labo. 4. The prepossessing bike scene gets less delightful when Primo starts throwing gibberish pick-up lines. Ganda na sana eh. Rickety in part but there’s so much that makes it worthy as a whole:5. Editing does not look as though it’s rushed. ‘Buti naman. 6. A dialogue-heavy scene backdropped by Amsterdam’s glaring flower fields and lovely sunset is my favorite. How would you feel if you’re in a beautiful place, talking to someone you love about how your lives got better after you painfully parted ways? Tearful acceptance, ganun. Ako, hindi ko alam. Unfathomable. 7. Second favorite is the harana/apology scene. Pain and kilig stirred together. 8. It may not be picture-perfect, but it’s a warehouse of authentic messages, inspirational ideologies, and lessons in love, which I gladly take away:- Relationships take great, great effort to maintain. It’s easy to give love and be happy when things are going well. But what happens when life suddenly feels as though it’s caving in with a spirit-crushing weight? Ang tanong eh kung kaya mo pa. Pero kung siya ayaw na, tama na. Ginawa ko na ‘yan. Okay naman ako. Pero ako lang ‘yun. - I give a nod everytime Primo says “Sayang iniwan kita, nagkahiwalay tayo,” and George will answer “but we became better persons.” Eh kasi tama naman. We don’t grow when things are easy, comfortable, and effortless. We grow when we face something beyond what we’re capable of handling. Kahit magkahiwalay pa kayo. Again, ako lang ‘to. - For the most beautiful part: Just because we think our heart is broken doesn’t mean it’s incapable to love again. (Sa’kin talaga galing to? Hahaha!) It’s those times when we have to step aside, heal in whatever foolish way we can, and remind ourselves of what keeps us going. It’s when we think na wala nang dahilan magmahal ulit kasi masasaktan ka lang ulit, that instead of curling up and hiding from the world, we gather our scattered bits of resolve to keep moving forward, whether with someone from the past, with someone new, or with yourself alone. Friend, life is worth every single moment. Be open to lessons from your hardships and misfortunes — they will build within you an unshakable passion, acceptance, understanding, and LOVE. THOU redefines my idea of living life, makes me want to fall in love again.
Solid first act. Gets droopy in the middle but is held up by Kathryn Bernardo's impeccable acting. Ends on a really sweet, heartfelt note.

I really dislike films where the movie itself tries to force you to root for a deeply problematic relationship, and excuse selfish behavior.Other than Daniel Padilla, the film doesn't work at a fundamental level. It's that bad to me.Edit: i was far too generous the first time
it’s great when it wasn’t trying. but it tried too hard. first act was good though.
Great storyline (plot and conflict felt so real, story-wise). Bad acting (obviously scripted, so unreal). Except for Kathryn’s (lead actress). Awesome job with the tears.

It felt like it's a poem-you've-read-before's movie version. Though there are these cringeworthy Amsterdam scenes and romantic lines that could have been more effective if it was said in vernacular, the formidable leads were still able to hit the soft spot with their relentless charm and chemistry.

This is one of Molina's best films although, that's not really saying much to be honest. It's elevated by the thoughtful and strong performances of its two leads but it's ultimately let down by a script that relies too much on cheesy lines that never really feel necessary and sometimes, some scenes are just a bit longer than they should have been. Overall, it's still really entertaining and Padilla and Bernardo prove once again why they are huge stars.
Competent. Daniel's great. But everything else is unremarkable. And. Awful title.

I'll be honest, I am not a fan of this love team. It's just not for me. To each his own.But I saw this film anyway, mostly for friendship. The intention was good, the plot was interesting and surprisingly not cliche (as is much of the mainstream Filipino films are these days, tbh), soundtrack was also nice. Just not a fan of the cast - and it's not because I'm not a fan of the couple. Even the supporting cast fell short. Tried my best to not be biased about it, but I found myself cringing a few times because of the sucky acting. Side note: Actors act, singers sing. That's how the world should work. Overall, decent film. You'll thoroughly enjoy it more if you're a Kathniel fan, I guess?

George’s character was somehow all of us in general. Sometimes we get tired or sometimes we feel like almost giving up but in the end we just want somebody to be there for us in that moment. To make us feel or just even tell us that everything will be okay. Primo’s character is also us in some moments of this so called life that we are in. We pursue our passion and only think of ourselves (I think, this is the majority of the millenials). But sometimes, unfortunately there will come a time that we’ll be in a crossroad and we only have to choose one path. Yourself or not yourself. They say, you are lucky if you found what you are passionate about and make a career out of it. But sometimes our stars doesn’t align in what we know we want to pursue and what we need or know to do. I consider myself lucky in my career. Not YET financially but I love what I’m doing and where I am at. My takeaway in the story is that if you love someone, fight for this person. No matter what. Sometimes like Primo, I ask myself, what if I fought for him?

This is a sweet film about two young people who fall in love, fall apart, and come back together. The film has three languages (I think) English, Spanish, and Tagalog (at least I'm guessing so) and cycles through them interspersedly which is fascinating to me because I can't even get beyond the one I currently speak. Both actors look a bit too young to make the time span of the movie completely believable -- they're either together seven years and then separated two or those two years are included in the seven, either way there's supposed to be at least seven years between when they first meet and when the film starts but they don't really look it. Overall a sweet film if nothing surprising.

In this film, when a girl says no, it means “yes but try harder” which sends a wrong message to the audience. Toxic relationships are toxic. Let’s not justify them. Primo was an asshole and his behavior was unacceptable. I’m pissed he got redemption. Also, if my asshole father abandoned my family, why the fuck would I want to see him? Let’s not further perpetuate the notion that being blood related is enough for forgiveness. My favorite rom-com bit is when they were selling their furniture then flashes back to what they were to them. Kathryn never looked this beautiful, proud of her. Hope one day she grows out of Kathniel and figure out better and more independent characters that don’t rely on cheesy romances.

I have always been checking for Daniel Padilla because I do think he has an impressive talent and very natural acting and charisma. I liked Kathryn in her previous shows and movies when she was younger but while she grew up, some of her acting appeared to be too mannered for me. In this movie however, Director Cathy Garcia-Molina flipped the script and made Kathryn shine more out of the duo. Don't get me wrong, Daniel is still a great screen presence but he was encumbered by what is, in my opinion, a deeply unlikable character while Kathryn got to play a long suffering and determined young lady and really got her chance to shine here. There are lots of parts of this movie that lost my rapt - the out of place Amsterdam part and newcomer Darren Espanto's stilted acting, to name a few. But Kathryn and Daniel's special brand of chemistry still drives this movie home.

Duhhh.. gue speechless.. film yang sempurna menuturkan tema pasang surut sebuah hubungan asmara jangka panjang yang dibina selama 7 tahun. Tentang bagaimana kedua insan berusaha saling memahami, menjaga hati dan ketika keduanya dihadapkan pada satu konflik yang memuncak, mereka saling mengharapkan dan berekspektasi lebih terhadap reaksi pasangannya. Georgina (Bernardo) ingin pasangannya, Primo (Padilla) lebih terlihat berjuang, padahal mereka punya 'pertempuran' dan cara berjuang yang berbeda dari sejak pertama mereka bertemu.Relate banget filmnya.. di saat pasangan harus saling mendukung, dari yang awalnya percaya dengan passion Primo, dan menerima segala kekurangannya dan bersabar. Georgina, merasa lelah sekian lama bekerja sambil kuliah, membayar tagihan, mengurusi rumah warisan neneknya, sementara Primo sibuk mengejar passionnya, yang awalnya membuat Georgina jatuh cinta.Hubungan keduanya sirna, saat Georgina merasa lelah dengan perjuangannya, mengeluh dan marah untuk pertama kalinya dan mengusir Primo. Ia berharap Primo bertahan mendengarkan keluhannya, bersabar menghadapi amarahnya dan lebih berjuang membantu lelahnya. Tetapi Primo malah pergi, membawa kekecewaan, rasa tidak dipercaya dan kegagalan. Keduanya berpisah dan baru bertemu kembali setelah 2 tahun.Primo kembali lagi, berusaha memperbaiki, tapi Georgina menganggapnya sudah terlambat. Semua sudah berakhir, tanpa mereka ketahui rahasia dan 'pertempuran hati' yang Primo pendam 2 tahun yang lalu.Filmnya punya chemistry yang bagus dan mengupas permasalahan dalam hubungan yang dalam dan logis. Rasanya semua orang bisa mengalami konflik dalam film ini. Kedekatan personal dan emosional jadi kunci di film yang punya teknis yang sederhana tapi dengan kekuatan skripnya menjelma jadi film yang kuat menggali emosi lewat dialog2 bagus dan dalam.My fave romance of all time.

‪Has a very simple premise, but #TheHowsofUs become a very enjoyable romantic comedy. Some of subplot maybe not really works and has a few cliche moments. But, Cathy Garcia-Molina's direction had her sensitivity to make this one become a very cute yet emotional film especially for the ending. The chemistry between Kathryn and Daniel was irrestisible. If you can't help for this kind of film, well bring the tissues then.

Film yang begitu lekat dan hangat. Kadang suka sebel, marah dan senyum-senyum sendiri ketika nonton film ini. Momen-momen ketika kalian pacaran tentunya dengan banyak sekali cobaan yang ada. Dan jangan lupa siapkan tisu kalau mau menonton film ini.

Meski ceritanya sederhana, The Hows of Us tetap membuat saya terkesima dengan kisah antara kedua tokoh utamanya. Chemistry, dialog yang manis, komedi, kisah romantis, serta adegan emosional terasa begitu menarik hati. Wajar saja kalau film ini merupakan film Filipina terlaris sepanjang masa.Cinepolis Kalibata City

Wajar jika The Hows Of Us adalah film Filipina terlaris sepanjang masa. Ia mempercakapkan perjalanan cinta dengan manis juga begitu mengharukan, walau memang—seperti Rasyid Harry katakan—terlampau lama. Salah satu drama romantis terbaik 2018.

Forget about the Filipino-romance formula plots, but the execution made me forget how appealing this can be. The lines said can be repeated by other Filipino drama-rom coms (or context are pretty much the same), but I just remembered that the screenwriters are the same people who wrote One More Chance which made me realize why this film gave much emotion. The story is plain simple and it was going okay as it goes along, but I think the father/Amsterdam thing was unnecessary, however, I'm not hating the not-tulips-but-other-flowers-on-the-field scene when they both finally realized they've become better people with their separation.It was also nice to see the evolution of this love team's acting; they just get better and better as time goes by, giving more opportunities for them to go with mature roles — including this one. I wouldn't hate it if they didn't end up together and had a good friendship instead, but of course...

I don't know if I have nearly as many questions about how this couple happened than I do about the one in "She's Dating a Gangster". This onscreen romance between Kathryn Benardo and Daniel Padilla can only be healthier than their last one under Cathy Garcia-Molina, but we're still talking about an aspiring musician and a medical student moving in together after she inherits her great aunt's hows-I mean house. I don't know how mature the film itself is with that wordplay in the title, so of course it's not too long before the med student gets tired of supporting the bum. Years later, "he just happens" to return declaring that he is a "changed man", but at least sticks around when he discovers that his ex-girlfriend blew up her medical career to whine about breaking up with her boyfriend. As if that's not unhealthy enough, after they ruined their first relationship with too much pressure, they have to start a new one by selling the house and finding the female lead's estranged father before her brother goes blind from diabetes. Along the way, they figuratively return to the debate club where they literally met to assess the "hows" that will save these lovers, even though the only one that counts is that they're played by Kathryn Benardo and Daniel Padilla. Filipino cinema's hottest power couple are sure to draw a crowd to what bickering they can manage, but the film still has to pander to them to oblivion.The masses might be a bit thrown off by the film's wildly convoluted nonlinear storytelling, and even then, it's mostly hard to keep up with the rapid-fire progression of the characters' arc settling into the house and adapting to their draggier reunion some years later. Something as overdramatic as a flashback structure mostly just shows how contrived this thing is, as a simplistic melodrama that forces conflict in the flashback storyline to spice up an initially "happy" home and facilitate its downfall, and blows the reunion arc on either randomly searching for an estranged father or a grown-ass doctor screaming about the "tragedy" of getting dumped. This film deals with some pretty sophisticated themes on how individuals are complexly shaped by their relationship, and although fairly likable character undergo a lot of change, it's all undone by those "I can't live with you" confrontations and "I can't live without you" declarations. It's never a particularly well-written romp, of course, the comedy being almost singularly embarrassingly juvenile screwball banter with friends or cutesy shenanigans with the couple, whose romantic interplays are devalued by sexual tension and saccharine dramatic progression. For the film to talk about moving into an adult relationship, this is in no way an adult movie, with Cathy Garcia-Molina being just one of many writers on a flimsy committee, and giving up on carrying this above that as directress. As full-hearted as her frantic overstylization, over-scoring, overpacing and overall overhandedness are, it's yet more grating pandering that wears down a superficial romantic dramedy. It's just a fluff piece, and it's sure to please the crowd, sometimes with actually tasteful elements.The wooded suburban house is a key character, and a comely one at that, with a beauty and humility beaming with some of the truest romance in the atmosphere of a film all about the hassle of a couple settling down. This sentimental tone is carried over by Jessie Lasaten's sweetly bright score and Noel Teehankee's dreamily polished cinematography, but without the maturity naturally inherent in that home. Cathy Garcia-Molina's direction just keeps going too far with the romantic disposition, but no matter how cloying this gets, there's always such honesty in such fiery emotion. As melodramatic as the film gets, there are times when Garcia-Molina is simply owning up to that with her dreamy sentiments, trusting that the cheese will be grounded by the admittedly fairly solid character factor. It's a romantic drama about growing up that is in no way grow-up, until there comes a point in both the flashback and present-day segments when the characters really start to break through, losing a grip of their prospects under the pressure of making a home, then reuniting some time later to further contemplate how they function as a unit. Juxtaposing these two processes deepen fairly sharp themes on understanding the differences between healthy dependency and toxic codependency; sacrificing your own prospects and supporting someone else's; and succumbing to the burden of a serious relationship and giving it time to breathe. I can tell you one thing: it's getting hard to see Kathryn Bernardo and Daniel Padilla functioning without each other, their radiant chemistry continuing to flourish alongside their bubbly charms and often surprisingly piercing emotional forces, as they try to hold together a film that is having a harder time managing fluff with true maturity.The nonlinear narrative is just part of the incessant contrivances that devalue a would-be mature love story, but not like the grating humor, histrionics and overstylization that render this strict pandering, with enough charm in its craft and punch-up, if not enough depth in its character developments and the leads' chemistry, to save Cathy Garcia-Molina's "The Hows of Us" a likably farcical romantic drama that warms your heart in some places and leave it cold in others.2.5/5 - Adequate

Joyce Bernal sa first act. Ang ingay lang, hindi naman earned. Bingung sebenarnya mau nulis review film ini gimana. Bukan karena filmnya jelek, tapi karena filmnya RELATABLE SEKALI, KAKAK. Aku bingung karena aku pasti kecurcol soal mantan. Aku gatel pengen cerita soal kehidupan percintaanku, sesuatu yang rasanya bisa menjijikkan buat dibaca orang lain. Bisa bikin orang lain memaki, “MANA BAHASAN SOAL FILMNYA, ANJIIIIIIR. MALAH CURHAT SI BANGKEEEEEE.” But… fuck it. Aku tulis aja deh. Aku nggak tau mau nulis apa juga. Selain film ini bagus kecuali adegan pas setting-nya berpindah di Amsterdam di mana pas bagian itu terasa membosankan. Bagi yang males dan mual kalau baca curhatan, bisa berhenti sampai di sini.-------------------------BATAS SUCI-----------------------------Tuh, aku bikinin batas sucinya ehehe.Aku ngerasa kenapa nonton ini pas banget dengan momen si mantan ngajak balikan. FYI, aku dan si mantan putus beberapa waktu lalu. Aku diputusin, lebih tepatnya. Ehehe.Film ini seolah bikin aku optimis mau dan bisa balikan sama mantan. Karena filmnya tentang pasangan yang putus terus balikan lagi. Tentang cowoknya yang buat salah terus cowoknya minta maaf, menyadari kalau ternyata dia yang salah dan berusaha berubah. The Hows of Us adalah mimpi basah bagi orang-orang kayak aku. Yang dalam lubuk hatinya pengen balikan tapi takut bakal hancur lagi. Yang ngerasa bingung kalau pake otak, jadinya rasional. Kalau pake hati, bisa senang tapi irasional. Kalau ngikutin otak, wajar banget rasanya kalau nggak balikan. Memang harusnya nggak balikan. Kalau ngikutin hati, rasanya pengen balikaaaaan aja. Memaafkan dengan mudah apa yang telah dilakukan mantan.Aku nggak bilang kalau sepenuhnya mantan yang salah. Aku juga salah. Aku nggak bisa memenuhi ekspektasinya. Aku nggak sesempurna yang dia mau. Aku udah berusaha berubah jadi apa yang dia mau, tapi aku nggak bisa. Rintangan yang dihadapi menuju ke 'arah sana' juga bukan dianggap cobaan, tapi halangan. Aku nggak berhasil meyakinkan dia buat terus berusaha demi aku. Demi kami.Aku paling ingat kata-katanya temannya George (Kathryn Bernardo), salah satu tokoh utama di film ini. “George, I know that story all too well. First, you start to listen. Then you believe what he says. Then you agree what he wants. Then you’re fooled again, you’re naive another time! Listen to me, do not repeat the same mistake!”George adalah perempuan cerdas yang bisa jadi contoh dari kalimat, “Kalau soal cinta, semua orang bisa jadi goblok.” Temannya George udah kayak Kak Ira, kakak sepupuku, pas nasehatin aku jangan sampai balikan sama mantan.Hiks. Ditambah lagi, George dan Primo (Daniel Padilla), sepasang kekasih yang udah jadi mantan, waktu pacaran punya panggilan sayang. Yaitu Jo.JO ANJEEEEER.KENAPA HARUS JO. ANJEEEEEEEEEEEER.FILM KURANG UAJAAAAAAAR. Ya gimana, aku manggil si mantan waktu masih pacaran dengan nama Jojo. Tapi aku sering panggil dia, “Jo,’ dan nama kontaknya di hapeku itu aku tulisin nama Jo. HUAAAAAAA KENAPA BISA KEBETULAN SIIIIH. Film ini brengsek. Patut aku bilang brengsek karena bikin aku optimis aja buat balikan sama si mantan. Bikin mikir kalau aku juga bisa kayak George yang akhirnya balikan sama Primo. Aku nggak bisa bohong dengan bilang aku nggak sayang sama mantan. Aku masih. Nggak berubah. Nggak tau sampai kapan. Aku pengen rasa ini berubah, minimal berkurang sedikit. Tapi malah…. aaaarrrrrrrgh. Cuman kalau balikan lagi, pasti kami berantem lagi. Nyakitin lagi masing-masing.Hahahaha. Hahaha. Haha. Ha.Ih ngeselin ya kalau jadi orang baperan. Mau nonton apapun dibaperin ke diri sendiri.
HOY GORGE HINDI SULIT BALIKAN SI PRIMO HAHAHAHA pagod na pagod si Kat sa pagbuhat ng film ah, mema lang yung Amsterdam scene meh tas kaLSS yung "Labis na naiiinis, nayayamot..."

Mengirah bakal disugihi kisah cinta pasangan bucin yg chessy dan bikin dahi mengkerut sangkin lebay nya, ternyata "The hows of us" tak semurahan yg di kira. Kisahnya malah sangat bagus, punya pesan mendewasakan yg bakal relevan dgn banyak pasangan diluar sana yg bakal atau sudah berumah tangga. Dengan konflik mengalir lancar dan menyentuh serta chemestry yg manis dari tokoh utama nya makah jangan heran kalian makin baper dibuat nya.Oustanding (4/5)

Downright mediocre. So many unnecessary hugot lines, drama scenes— typical Cathy Molina-Carmi Raymundo movie. Moses even said to me: “mababaw luha mo, bakit di ka umiyak?”. Why would I? As a matter of fact, I was cringing for the most parts, the movie also romanticized a problematic relationship. Why???? I enjoyed the first act though, but that was it. The rest? Meh. Totally unwatchable if not for Kathryn. So kudos to her. Dinala niya buong movie, eh. That one star is for Kath and Orange & Lemon’s music as OST. Also, tangina talaga ng mga lalakeng kuhang-kuha ka sa isang ngiti at kanta nila. Buti na lang masaya na ko.!Anyway, I think I’m more game to write a 2000-word article on how Friday nights spent watching Pinoy movies with Pinoy friends at Holland Village became a thing.

Sebuah film drama yang mempunyai cerita yang tidak baru.Sebenarnya film ini bisa menjadi tontonan yang menghibur, namun dalam eksekusinya film ini seperti terlalu panjang karena ada cerita sampingan seperti adiknya yang sakit, pencarian sang ayah yang sebenarnya tidak penting. Sehingga menonton film ini cukup melelahkan. Padahal bila film ini fokus terhadap pasang surut hubungan sang tokoh utama, maka film ini sangat manis.Sebuah film dengan rasa opera sabun yang durasinya terlalu lama.Setidaknya lagunya cukup enak didengar.

Membosankan, dari dulu karakter Kathryn dan Daniel begitu2 saja.Ceritanya nggak ada yang spesial sih. Tentang kesuksesan, karier, idealisme, dan cinta. Ada plot adiknya yang mau banget ketemu ayahnya di Belanda. Menurutku itu nggak perlu. Kayak nggak ada efeknya buat jalan cerita utama. Seakan mau pamer aja syut di Amsterdam, setelah sebelumnya di Barcelona di film Barcelona A Love Untold. Tapi bukan berarti buruk. Walau klise, cerita dibuat se-believeable mungkin. Sebab akibatnya. Konsekuensinya. Tentang si perempuan yang muak dengan idealisme cowoknya. Masa si Daniel (eh aku lupa di sini nama peran dia siapa? sudah nonton sebulan lalu) nggak mau nyanyi bahasa Inggris di kafe hanya karena idealisme. Hehehehe. Mending situ nyanyi di kamar mandi, kan beda musisi pro dan musisi kamar. Maksudnya keidealismean dia terlalu banyak dan kurang menohok aja. Bahkan sampai ditinggalkan temen ngebandnya. Mungkin mereka disuruh ganti genre dangdut kali ya sama produser rekamannya sampai Daniel nolak ambil proyek rekaman.Si Kathryn gagal jadi dokter, karena mengurus suami kumpul kebonya. Mereka belum kawin sih. Tapi bebas, kan Filipina. Di sini juga ada wkwkw. Aku suka aja kegerahan Kathryn dengan toxic relationships antara mereka berdua. Kalau cinta itu butuh duit, bukan cuma kepercayaan. Sayang aja mesti happy ending dan mereka balikan lagi. Kalau gue mah ogah, emansipasi ciiinn. Women empowerment  Sebenarnya kalau kita sering nonton film dan sinetron mereka berdua, mirip lah kayak couple Michelle Zuidith dan Rizky Nassar atau Dimas Anggara. Sutradaranya juga sama aja. Kayak ditulis khusus penggemar mereka. Waktu film ini tayang di bioskop Indonesia, banyak komen filmnya syedih bingitttt. Four Sisters and the Wedding: take my tissue!

Baru pertama kali nonton film Filipina. Kocak juga anzenkkk dengerin bahasa Tagalog dicampur bahasa Inggris. Walaupun film nya serasa FTV banget, untungnya kedua pasangan bazingan ini enak untuk diliat.

I'll be honest, this movies was on my bucketlist so my expectations were kinda high. It's a VERY TYPICAL Filipino romantic film. There was nothing new about it that would make your mind blown. Most of the scenes are those that you can see in other filipino films such as after the break up, the guy will return to win back the lost love of the girl, the "traveling to other places to strengthen the relatonship" and the overly dramatic confrontation scenes. (which in fact 'caused me to be teary eyed lol!) What makes it more exciting was Daniel Padilla and Kathryn Bernardo was in it! They were so good together and you can just feel the love they have for each other. They demonstrated good acting skills and their script- DAMN. Most of it were heartbreaking. Overall, I did like this movie and I can feel that most of the people in the cinema enjoyed it as well.

The first act, sweetie, you're doing amazing! The Amsterdam sequence—you don't even go here Just when I thought this film strayed away from formulaic, comfortable rom-com that never fails to have: a hugot festival, kids with parental issues, and the need to go to special places to release repressed feelings, instead it stayed loyal to it. The beginning was so promising, may pa-slow motion pa, but it wasn't consistent. Also, I'm curious as to how and why they make the audio in these types of films. There's something about how voices are amplified too much or smoothened out. Sometimes, it looks like it was dubbed which I find disturbing. Anyway, Kathryn Bernado's acting is stale as ever and I almost pity Daniel Padilla who caged in roles as a charismatic loverboy that it scares me to see him outside it.

While the start and main problem were promising, the formulaic resolution was very disappointing. I just don't get the point of already starting with the post-breakup, and then showing the redeeming value of Primo was with him all along, even before the breakup, as if pointing out that it was all a misunderstanding. This subtly puts the blame on George for not knowing that Primo was actually a good man (she should have just trusted him!).This should have been a film about HOW Primo acknowledges his accountability and redeems himself, and HOW George finally finds in herself the courage to forgive and love again. That would have been less formulaic, less harmful, and most probably very endearing.Also, what's with the exaggerated acting? Almost all of them are good to great actors (except of course for Espanto), and yet most of them were also over the top. I think, because they have proven in their other projects that they can act, that it's a directorial problem. Which is also suprising, given that this is Garcia-Molina we are talking about.

the only thing i don't like about this movie is that we all know that their relationship is already toxic and yet we are being forced to root for that said couple. but i also believe that there is a room for change and development for one's self, and both george & primo showed that they did become better people.anyway 1 star because this movie almost made me cry. 2 stars for kathryn bernardo herself, she must be very tired of carrying the whole movie by herself.

This is the first Kathniel project i ever truly liked — loved even! In typical Star Cinema fashion, the movie starts with a chaotic scene depicting hyperactive leads that, somehow, lose that hyperactivity through the rest of the film.In another typical Star Cinema fashion, insert the need to shoot in a foreign country. I have to be honest, though — those Amsterdam scenes could have also panned out effectively if shot in some remote province in the Philippines. But, yeah, I know Amsterdam doesn’t require permits for filming there, so I guess Star Cinema took the opportunity to film and have a European vacation at the same time. Typical Filipino showbusiness tactic. Splitting the house in two - seen that many times, mostly in comedies. It did the job for this movie, though. It worked as a story device that did not feel forced.Anyway, Kathryn and Daniel have both really matured in this movie. Especially Kathryn — in all her previous movies where she was supposed to play an adult, she didn’t quite do so well. I mean, acting-wise, she did. But in terms of looks, she always looked like some teenager and, sometimes, even a child. So I commend the styling team for doing a good job with her look for “The How’s of Us”. Her screen presence matured. As for Daniel, boy, has he grown into a man. I especially love him in this role. I love it when men are depicted as soft, vulnerable, and pitiful — in the context of a love story, of course.And this — I cried. Yup. I tried to hold back the tears, but I just couldn’t. This is the true hallmark of good storytelling — when you fight your emotion, but it gets the better of you.

don’t get me wrong, kathryn and daniel did well on this film, especially the former who seemingly carried the film on her back (as most critics seem to be saying— and i agree) but, as there always is an apprehensive but, the storyline was, objectively and personally, not to my taste. not only did it remind me and my mother (who cried very hard might i add) of my parents’ abusive relationship, it was just . . . hard to force myself to like primo. i saw too much of my father in him, a man i hate and have no pity for. they were too alike— in their actions, words, beings, so how could i forgive one and crucify the other?i think this brings us back to how good of an actor daniel was in this film. i don’t think it was his best performance, but it definitely wasn’t his worst. he portrayed primo very well, showcasing the complexities of his being making one question whether or not he really deserves to be forgiven. (i personally would not have forgiven him, i have to say. the relationship that primo and george had was too toxic, and it hit a little too close to home than my liking)there are many things i would still like to say about this film, perhaps i’ll expound more on this when the morning comes. just know that this was a good watch, not the best, not the worst, but good.

"George, I'm sorry.""And what makes that sorry different from all your other sorrys before?"I've always been a devoted admirer of Kathniel, eagerly anticipating each of their upcoming movies. They stand out as my preferred Filipino loveteam, especially since I used to follow Social Seryes on Twitter inspired by their story. My admiration for Daniel Padilla and Kathryn Bernardo deepened after watching this particular film in theaters.While the movie's plot follows the typical, cliché, and foreseeable pattern of Filipino romance films, I found it delightful because of the remarkable chemistry between the two leads. Somehow, they infused it with a special and heartfelt quality. Kathryn Bernardo's acting deserves special recognition; her exceptional performance left a lasting impact, even stirring my emotions at 3:00 AM.Forgiveness, a challenging virtue, becomes particularly daunting when faced with someone who has caused you pain and shattered your self-esteem. The decision to forgive or harbor perpetual resentment carries immense pressure, complicated further by the fear of disappointing those opposed to your chosen path.I won't deny that Primo was quite the jerk in the past, blinded by his dreams to the harsh realities around him. Despite acknowledging George's struggles in a letter, he failed to take meaningful action. His reckless behavior, fueled by alcohol, exacerbated their financial woes. Fortunately, George displayed remarkable understanding and selflessness. It's heartening that Primo eventually transformed into a better person, learning from his mistakes and genuinely committed to fixing everything.In contrast, I resonate more with George's approach. I refuse to let the same person inflict harm on me once again.

I still think that SDTG is Kathniel's best film (despite the unnecessary medical-related sub-plot), but THOS is so special. This is Daniel Padilla's best. I saw him grow as an actor from the same bad boy teenager roles since Growing Up, and his comfortability on screen makes him better.What I do not like about the film is the same medical-related subplot, the parental issues, friends/family conflicts. Same Cathy Garcia-Molina formula. Same Filipino romcom formula. What made this film better though is how warm and pleasant Kathryn and Daniel act together. Their chemistry made this film work. I would have loved this more if the film focuses on Primo and George's story. More scenes during their stay on Tita Lola's house, what happened after Primo left, and after Primo came back. It's like the Barcelona: A Love Untold. Too many sub-stories that could have been deleted.Overall, I love it. THIS IS DANIEL PADILLA'S MOVIE.

At two hours long, "The Hows of Us" was limited severely by so much bloat and so many tropes that it really made us wonder why they just didn't tell a straightforward story in the first place. But don't get us wrong though, it wasn't a bad experience at all and we actually found ourselves liking this film much more than we anticipated. But its barely middling middle section should have been reworked maybe even removed.For years, Jo (Kathryn Bernardo) and Primo (Daniel Padilla) had a long-lasting relationship so much so that when Jo’s Aunt died, she left her house to the both of them. But with Primo, a budding musician, failing to attain the success that he feels he is beholden to and with Jo feeling that Primo’s failures are holding her back, Primo abandons Jo all by herself. A few years pass by when Primo suddenly shows up and wants to fix the wrongs he has done in the past - including his relationship with Jo. But this isn’t as simple as it sounds as Jo plans to sell their house soon and hasn’t really forgiven and forgotten that Primo left her to fend for herself. We must admit that “The Hows of Us” left us with a heavy dose of mixed feelings. On one hand, its narrative and story really had potential to be substantially and emotionally moving. But the film also suffers because it felt it needed to do genre tropes within its story that was just unnecessary. For example, there’s a parent or sibling who suffers a sickness in the most opportune time or simply travelling to a foreign country. We wished it just told a more straightforward and down-to-earth story - one that we could actually imagine happening in real-life and not one obviously written for the big screen. While the overall narrative was bloated, the film actually had bright spots. In fact, the first thirty minutes and last thirty minutes were outstanding in our opinion. It had us gripping our seats with emotionally moving moments. Of course, these scenes were bolstered by the great chemistry and acting between Kathryn Bernardo and Daniel Padilla. Overall though, “The Hows of Us” will make you swoon in key moments and if that’s what you’re after, you’ll actually find it a story worth experiencing. Source: www.reeladvice.net/2020/10/the-hows-of-us-movie-review.html

If you saw me crying during this movie, no you didn't. Kathryn Bernardo was amazing in this film. Her acting really matured so much, and you could tell that she and Daniel worked extremely hard on it. The two had revealed that some of their lines had been taken from their own relationship, and it makes a lot of sense. The emotion they'd all put out was genuine, and it was all a lot of great acting. It was also a really good story for the duo's usual repertoire, and I love that they decided to give them a more mature story that was on the level of Cathy Garcia-Molina's masterpieces like One More Chance. It was relatable, fun and heartbreaking all at the same time. It's a great Filipino movie. I highly recommend.

this is peak Pinoy romcom cinema. it has everything you’d expect; flashbacks and flashforwards, a junket trip to Europe, 2 charismatic leads, etc. what separates this from the fluff is its execution, the story (up until the end) is well crafted and avoids the natural pitfalls of the premise it set up for itself. the protagonists have agency and do not make any decision just for plot contrivance. not to say this is a perfect movie, it has its problems— the editing and pacing is not quite there. it spends way too much time meandering through Amsterdam, and crafting a Pixar Up-like sequence in the beginning was not necessary if they were only going to spend a lot of running time going through the past all over again, so there is no economy of storytelling present. my biggest problem though is the ending. i understand why they did it the way they did, but imo it was completely unnecessary and actually harms the characters’ growth during the movie. SPOILER what the ending does is retcon the movie’s story; we find out in the end that Primo actually knew he was being a selfish prick before he left, but instead of actually doing something about it, he instead, what, wrote a letter? that makes it okay? that actually makes it worse, because now we know he had a CHOICE to be better 2 years ago, but he chose not to. his 2 years of change therefore did not matter because it implies he in fact didn’t change, at all. then they have George APOLOGIZING to him? as if anything was her fault? that is wrong on so many levels. this development looks unfortunately to have been put there only to create a reason for George to get back together with Primo in time for the movie to end, but this was completely unnecessary. Primo has grown as a person, he’s already shown this to George, and George already acknowledges that he has. there was no need for the letter. instead, what they should have done was, after all the items have been sold off, have both of them say farewell to their past selves, the people that owned that house, and reintroduce each other as new people. have the movie end with George agreeing to go on a first date with Primo, a chance that this time around, things will work out.

A friend asked me to watch it and I thought I'd give it a try. My eyes couldn't handle the amount of eye rolls I did in the time I wasted watching this movie. Reasons for my eye-roll:1. Direk Cathy Garcia's signature ill-fitted wigs. Seriously, why?2. Overly cheesy dialogue. Nobody talks like that in real life, especially those 2 leads, it just doesn't suit them. It's so forced.3. Meh plotline. Nothing new there. It's obviously a money-grabbing, fan service blandness.4. Not well-acted at all. Not one of them. But especially, Kathryn. Please, crying easy doesn't mean your acting is effective.5. Philippine cinema formula. Yes, let's shoot at overseas location to use the beautiful sceneries as background and our studio gave us extra budget anyway eventhough it doesn't really add anything to the story itself. Check.6. The unnecessarily long runtime of 117 minutes. There's lot of useless stuff there. Does this film think it's an epic?7. What's up with that end credits scene? Soooo cringey.8. If Kathniel and Direk Cathy think this is their mature take on romance movie, they're deluded. It's another pinoy love team movie crap wrapped in shiny paper designed to tickle non-thinking fans so the movie team can reap the blockbuster benefits.

Ugh boy. It started with a promising first act that got me really hooked on to the movie and liking it right away. There were scenes that were all too real and relatable. Then the second act came and this movie just falls into like any other Filipino romantic drama films with the “return of the exes and still hung up from each other after not seeing or communicating after many years but it felt like nothing has changed and we still love each other so much that we end up together because LOVE CONQUERS ALL ADVERSITIES” trope with a little bit of an identity crisis from our supporting characters as a side plot.I really thought this film was gonna give us a tale of couples dealing with ups and downs and eventually, a breakup and going through the transition of being single after being in a committed relationship for so long. It did touch that issue in the first act but it was so rushed and I just didn’t feel any sympathy or connection with the characters. I really believe this movie isn’t really worth the hype.Phenomenal acting from Kathryn but still unimpressed with Daniel’s acting ability still. He REALLY needs to break away from that moody bad boy/rebel typecast it is really getting old.

The Hows of Us is a drama romcom type film about a Filipino boyfriend musician and a girlfriend on her way to being a doctor growing individually as well as through their relationship in ties with their new home purchase. The film touches on aspects of romance/love, aspects of grief loss, aspects of depression, aspects of addiction, aspects of being a homeowner, aspects of negative pride, aspects of romantic relationships/friendships, aspects of maturity, aspects of family, and aspects of diabetic retinopathy amongst other points. The camera work is on point. The acting partners fulfill the film. I find the film funnier than sad. The film has some interesting messages about relationships. Though I think a lot is simply put together to fluff the film/make it make more sense toward the end, I find the film entertaining.

hindi ko alam if i’m just getting back into pinoy movies or my star cinema melodrama bias is acting up but i really liked this movie. kathryn is such a good actor and i’m realizing that more than ever. daniel is decent at most but it does feel natural to see him with kathryn— and that plays a huge part on how we see him on screen. most actors are great aside from darren. palagi naman may ini-introduce na “young talent” ang star cinema in all of their movies na hindi talaga marunong umarte so i guess masasanay ka na din. yun lang, ang pangit at awkward talaga. isa pang pansin ko: color grading sa amsterdam scenes sobrang processed! you’re already in amsterdam, might as well follow its natural vibe instead of presenting it as a much brighter, summery place compared to the philippines (where it’s always bright and summery). plot-wise, decent pero overused as usual. sa script lang lagi nagkakatalo ang mga star cinema melodramatic romance blockbusters and this was average. kathryn lang talaga nagdala. and she did a damn good job! parang character niya sa movie, dalang-dala niya si daniel. good for her! go girl! ayun, overall ay bigyan natin siya ng 3.5 stars. it’s definitely good enough to be called generally well-made. at napaiyak niya ako so laking factor din yun for this very serious and very lengthy review in the very revered letterbox.

The Hows Of Us could've been a strong film, especially with Kathryn Bernardo's effective acting. But the topsy turvy storytelling ruined a good experience. It started off too serious and heavy, then shifted to a corny rom-com approach and a third act that's unnecessary (ma-justify lang ng prod team pag-abroad nila under Star Cinema's expense). Daniel Padilla's acting is generic and was overshadowed by Kathryn's more upfront character. Still, they do kilig scenes the best. The dialogue would hit couples who experienced a similar dilemma as Primo and George - and that's a real dart to the heart.
"'Yan naman kasing tita-lola niyo e, masyadong naniwala na forever ang loveteam niyo e."
Nakakaasar ang sakit pero ang ganda.

The film's premise surely captures the kind of sentimentality that is born out of selfless devotion. George (Kathryn Bernardo) represents every doting lover who understands that love is both a struggle and sacrifice. But she's human enough to reach her breaking point, that non-singular moment Primo (Daniel Padilla), her lover, erodes into a miserable man. That's outright promising, given an opportunity to go deep into the characters' core. Until the narrative submits to Star Cinema formula. While Primo tries to win George back, a lot of other things happen, all brazenly pointing to them realizing they need to be back together, even if he decides to set her free--a banal device that aims to make love look elusive but more intense. Because how are these two characters supposed to respond to other charcters whose sole duty is to remind them that they still love each other? The sequences in Amsterdam feel like you're watching a different film, with characters so eager to accomplish something for a great cause. The attempt at proving its significance by way of editorializing the flowers and the sunset does not put weight on either the characters or the narrative itself. Daniel effortlessly delivers, his eyes expressing the right emotions. Kathryn tries hard, a few times she's hitting it. Other times she's like a dainty, vulnerable young girl being forced to battle tough times. Her eyes convey ambiguity rather than perceptive and penetrating responses that don't demand words. Her delivery of "quotable quotes" and the lines in the debate scene sounds like a graded recitation (yung mukhang minemorize nang maigi).And then the film gets too didactic, telling us what we should make of how Primo and George triumphed at their story and how we should distinguish battle and war as metaphors for love (kung maka-figure of speech!). The film is supposed to tackle maturity in relationship, but it appears that its depiction does not quite go with its marketing. And Star Cinema is not bothered by such incongruency. It just continues to shape love through a narrative that always turns factitious and simplistic. It does not mind reducing it into the fundamentals of melodrama and simplified association or discourse.

The second highest grossing movie of the Philippines of all time is indeed a gem. The Hows of Us is in fact an anti-love story. The movie explores not the best moments in a relationship but sets it’s focus on the moments that were the beginning of the end. The calm vibe and the direct confrontations of the couple make the movie captivating and leave a bitter taste. Bernardo and Padilla act so damn good in this film that I had to check if they indeed broke up in real life. So many emotional moments and the question “Who’s right?” pull the viewer into the story. The rain scene is one of the most legendary moments in Filipino cinema for me. So many emotions with so less words really got me. I really loved the movie and can understand why every Filipino I met recommended me this masterpiece. It’s worth watching!

Perhaps the most formally assured of these--Garcia-Molina plays with temporality in interesting ways, and utilizes spaces extremely well, using set design to suggest barriers between her leads--and these are my favorite KathNiel performances so far, but, I found the story a bit too busy, cramming extra sub-plots (a health scare AND a long-lost father?) that distract from the central relationship (and they do much more than merely distract: they actively conspire against it, as it keeps alive the dream that external events could solve the problems in their relationships....which is never the case, the changes must come from within!)But perhaps I'm being harsh, as this is a serious, adult drama (albeit with moments of levity), one that isn't content with the rosy-eyed "relationships are easy" view (nor one that ignores its characters material circumstances; money pressures drive all the key events in the film).

Mikko : "George, katakan yang sebenarnya. Untuk apa garis ini?"George : "Untuk Primo. Untuk mengingatkannya bahwa dia memiliki batasan.Mikko : "Hmm, ini bukan untuk menghentikan Primo yang datang kedalam hidupmu lagi. Ini untuk menghentikanmu agar tidak jatuh cinta lagi padanya."Awee : "Karna ketidakhadiran membuat hati semakin dekat, tetapi kehadiran menempatkan hati dalam bahaya.The Hows of Us (2018) bercerita tentang sepasang kekasih yang pernah saling mencintai, kemudian putus dan bersatu kembali. Terdengar simpel, sederhana dan sudah ketebak. Tapi yang membuat film ini berbeda dengan drama percintaan pada umumnya adalah pengemasannya. Pemilihan kata dalam dialognya yang sempurna, banyak yang relate dengan kisah seperti ini dan film ini juga sangat jujur dan realistis. Cathy Garcia-Molina berhasil mengangkat kisah biasa yang sering dialami dalam hubungan, sesuai realita, namun dikemas dengan sangat baik. Film kedua dari sutradara perempuan Filipina Cathy Garcia-Molina yang aku tonton. Berawal dari Hello, Love, Goodbye (2019) dengan soundtracknya "Ikaw At Ako" yang masih terngiang-ngiang dikepala menuntunku ke film ini, dan aku ketagihan dengan caranya bertutur dalam filmnya, jujur aku menikmatinya. The Hows of Us (2018) juga kabarnya memecahkan banyak rekor perfilman di Filipina dan menjadi film terlaris sepanjang masa di Filipina.Duet Kathryn Bernardo dan Daniel Padilla udah kayak benar-benar pasangan pada umumya, natural kali gak lebay dan berlebihan. Oh ya baru tau juga aku kalo mereka katanya dinobatkan sebagai pasangan klop yang sering dipasangkan diberbagai serial drama dan film. Kalo di Indo mungkin kayak Rizky Nazar sama Michelle Ziudhit kali ya, yang selalu jadi pasangan di FTV, film, atau series. Makanya chemistri mereka berdua udah matang kali.

Streaming on Netflix now is this topgrossing 2018 Filipino drama that i somehow liked and shamefully but not secretly enjoyed and bawled my eyes out to.  It tells the story of former lovers Primo and George who, at the beginning of the film, relive the days and sad occasions that led to their break-up. For fans of Filipino tearjerkers, a box of tissue may not be enough for this film. It will squeeze you out dry but you will not be complaining. This movie hits all the right formula in the genre. From the beautiful cast to the relatable relationship drama that’s been a staple of Philippine cinema for decades now. The story is somewhat typical but the storytelling is fresh. The conflict is as old as Sharon Cuneta’s first movie (or could be older) but the execution somehow feels novel. There are many cutesy scenes definitely constructed for the diehard fans of the loveteam but it somehow does not offend or get in the way of the developing drama. There is a subplot that will not ordinarily work but somehow works here. Every emotion this movie elicits from the audience is definitely earned. The great character actress Odette Khan appears in a cameo towards the end of the movie that only made me love this film more.
