My second rewatch thoughts:This film is actually kind of good. What I don't like about it is how unrealistic some of the scenes are, but it's saved by the amazing performance of Kathryn and her co-star Daniel. The chemistry they both have is seen clearly in here. Of course, it wouldn't be a Star Cinema film without the following:1. an emotional scene while raining2. going abroad3. medical issues4. daddy/mommy issues5. cheesy and sometimes even cringy lines that feels unrealistic if said in real life.With all of these in mind, I enjoyed the film because it shows the struggle between the people, and how we should always have each other's back no matter what. " The story they end up telling is actually pretty simple, but there are just so many other things that crowd out the much more affecting core of this story: two people still clearly in love with each other, just trying to overcome the hurt that also still exists between them. "

Akala ko nung una heavy drama to..... 1. Ang ganda sa umpisa kaso naiba yung direksyon ng kwento nung kalagitnaan hanggang huli2. Contrary sa nakita kong reactions ng fans, di ako agree na problematic si Primo. Oo, idealistic siya at ma-pride. Pero bata pa siya nun. Atsaka tingin ko may pagkukulang din si George. Sa relasyon kasi, dapat may communication. Bigayan kumbaga. Kaso, pareho silang nagsasarili ng hinanakit nila. Pwede naman maayos yan sa masinsinang usapan. Di sinabi ni George yung expectations niya kay Primo at nagtiis nalang siya sa gilid hanggang napuno na siya3. Gusto ko pang makilala si Primo. Parang dito sa movie na to, albeit lovestory siya, mas focused kay George yung kwento. Naging 'pixie dream girl' si Primo. Gusto ko siya. Partly siguro dahil ang charismatic ni Daniel Padilla 4. May ibang plot lines and characters na unnecessary at naging plot device lang sila. Gaya nung past romance movie na napanood ko, di na kelangan pumunta sa ibang bansa para gawing nakakakilig yung story. Tbh, parang irrelevant nga sa main story yung Amsterdam plot nila.5. Sobrang rare talaga siguro ng filipino romance (lalo na yung focused sa loveteam) na maging grounded sa reality. May ibang lines sa movie na kung di korni eh unrealistic. Like, wala namang taong nakakaisip agad ng hugot line and take note, yung sobrang madrama pa. Gusto ko lang siguro talaga ng romance story na makatotohanan. Yung pakiramdam mo totoong tao talaga yung mga characters at hindi para for kilig lang

I’ve watched this film countless times and I just want to watch it again because of the soundtrack number one, the story and because I’m sick and in no mood to watch new movies. Plus I missed this movie because of the trend that’s going around tiktok right now tumawid ka na baby. It reminds me of him in a bittersweet way. Primo the ultimate red flag. I’m quite happy na alam ko sa sarili ko that I would never let this happen to me under any circumstance. It’s just not possible for me be in this situation. First I have a rule I made for myself, that if I want to be in a relationship or to experience relationships it would be during high school. Because I won’t be going to college with a boyfriend. I can’t afford distraction, medicine is already too much I can’t afford to bother with another humans physical and mental health? Plus what do you need a man for? What exactly is their use? You won’t gain anything from, physical touch is 0% on my love language so men would be a 100% hindrance in my case. And don’t start with “makakahanap ka din ng katapat mo” or “bitter, sino nanakit sa ‘yo?” Wala. Tumahimik ka nalang because like men I don’t need an opinion from you about myself. If I’m gonna be honest, I like Primo sa una, he is totally my type, passionate and knows what he wants in life. He’s also smart, musikero plus he’s Daniel Padilla for goodness sake? But my favorite character in this movie would still be Mikko my love the only one who has sense. But kahit ilang beses kong panuorin ‘rong movie na ‘to ‘pag hindi ako maga pause babaha nanaman here sa bahay. I tend to invalidate peoples feelings ‘pag nasabi nila na about sa relationship kung bakit sila depressed. And for all the people feelings whom I invalidate you deserve an apology. I’m so so sorry. My mindset used to be makipag break ka na tapos na lahat ng problema mo I mean for me hindi parin s’ya mahirap but maybe for others it won’t be that easy and I’m slowly opening to that possibility. I’m glad God didn’t give me a friend like George because I only would cry with her because of how much I care about her and I would go to jail because I would accidentally kill Primo. I love Kathryn and Daniel’s acting, I love all their movies omit Barcelona from the list I didn’t appreciate that movie quite as much. I love Can’t help falling in love, she’s dating the gangster of course a classic and this film. This movie has the potential to have my 5 stars and like if it weren’t for Darren Espanto can someone please remove him from the movie. I literally skip every time I see him, his acting was not it. He acts too young for his age in the movie, ‘yung eye sight may problema sa’yo not mentally. I’m so sorry for saying all this but seriously, ang childish? Who made him an actor? He’s a singer not an actor, porket na famous doesn’t mean he has the talent to act, y’all could literally choose anyone tapos he doesn’t look remotely close to the younger version of Yohan, that little kid did it better by the way. He infuriated me more than Primo did all through the movie.Na delete ‘yung other review ko fml. Anyway I just finished the movie and earlier I said I’m so glad that it is impossible for me to experience something like this, but at the end the pain and love of the kiss George and Primo shared made me think what it feels like to fall in love and fall out of love and fall in love all together. I don’t think they ever stopped loving each other but you get my point. I could never experience loving or being loved that hard ever. Anyway, where is the new kathniel film?! The house arrest of us sucks I would rate it a negative if I could. Cringe sobra I feel so bad for the both of them to be forced to do this show.

Honest thought, this could've been a good (not great) movie if George and Primo didn't end up together. The first few minutes of the film was okay, a bit realistic, but onwards, it became super cheesy and frustrating. Please, for the love of God, free Kathryn Bernardo from Daniel Padilla and Cathy Garcia Molina (and other mainstream directors). She either greatly overshadows DJ's acting skills or DJ drags her down with his acting (or the lack thereof). She also wouldn't grow as an actress if she just keeps getting the same role with different names. Cathy Molina has done it again with her favorite movie formula: the toxic guy gets in a relationship with the positive strong woman, they break up, guy or girl goes to a different country and then goes back to the Philippines years later, guy woos girl (redemption arc), girl forgives guy, and they live happily ever after. God, this is why Filipinos love to romanticize problematic relationships and toxic men.

“Patience.”This is the moral of the movie. George and Primo showed a realistic relationship. It is not always a romantic one, sometimes it can be sad and heartbreaking. They let each other because they are tired — but letting go each other makes them grow and be the person they want to be. It is a matter of staying through thick and thin, through your darkest days. It is all about the patience we have in love. Sometimes we get tired, but it doesn't mean we don't want anymore. We just get tired, but we can rest.Maybe one of the lines that I can forget is, “we cannot survive to a battle if we fight each other, but staying together can conquer the battle.”This is one of the best Filipino movie I've ever watch, and undeniably the best KathNiel film ever produced. No doubt, this movie is the 2nd Highgest Grossing Filipino of all time. A masterpiece.

I liked this more than I expected. My expectations were so much lower than what I got.I just wished they deviated away from romcom because they definitely tried that out a bit for the first act, and for me it feels too forced.When the serious tone went on for the second act until it ended, that mood and pace worked for me better. I feel like they should've just stuck to that. But I get the romcom execution of the first act since they want to engage audience better.Good one to watch if you want a introspection about the sours of life and love. Not a fun one though so expect emotions.
nakita ko lang sa twitter ayun napapanood tuloy ako

Love the cold open--contemporary and innovative.Primo's a fucking red flag, egocentrically manipulative as ever. But perhaps Tita Lola was the real antagonist here, charot.Galing ng EO product placement.Very cliché, nakaka-cringe, as always with KathNiel films, but it’s their best films I've watched.I was wondering bakit kailangan umuulan pag may strong heartfelt scene between the two of them. I figured it must be symbolism for George's turmoiled feelings toward Primo. Tulips are definitely a symbolism as well for George's ideal partner. Primo gave him a plastic ones when he was courting her.Background music or the musical scoring can be a little excessive in some scenes, but I realized that commercial local films do be like that. Was it necessary to resolve George and her brother's daddy issue? I don't think that was essential, but the film could've been done without the Amsterdam trip. It could've ended with when they already sold the house. The whole Amsterdam trip and there on was like a second act.Overall, despite being cliche, good execution. Deserve naman ang pagiging batikan ni Direk Cathy Garcia-Molina, time-tested na rin. Subok na ng panahon, ganern.George's mistake was falling in love with Primo's potential.Personally, I resonate with George with her territorial and sungit trait; but damn, she's right, she's dumb and weak when it comes to the fucking guy. I WOULDN'T tolerate Primo's comeback if I were her. Pero feel ko binalikan niya lang din out of convenience and because first and only love. Fave character ko si Mikko dito, the very logical friend.Disappointing ending for me, rupok.

Realistic, emotional, and heartwarming. I really admire Primo’s character development to fight for his love for George. He was tireless in spite of the actuality that George repeatedly rejected his return in her life, that’s where I deeply feel that Primo’s true love for George kept going and it also kept on growing profusely as the time passed by. In the middle of the story, I was kind of confused by Primo’s behavior which was still blurry about where will they take their future to? I daresay it’s very related to the lives in the present time, especially for couples who want to bring their relationships to an improved or more serious level. I feel like watching real life experiences of a couple who became wise with their life experiences, hence it feels so real. It truly deserves a great rating!

grabe magmahal si george, handang tumalon ng jeepney at mamiss yung nmat niya para lang sa awoj niyang hindi naman kayang kilalanin mga efforts and sleepless nights niya.the ending felt disappointing, kasi it feels like all of george’s efforts to lock primo out of her life (rightfully so) were thrown out of the window once again just for the sake of the main couple being “endgame” which in and of itself, is a concept that gets pretty annoying when the audience knows that “endgame” is not always the fastest and best solution for every unmended relationship. primo left george after hearing just one complaint from her that she’s tired of always carrying the relationship, let that sink in.nawa’y wag nating tularan si george na kumakapit pa sa isang relasyon na hindi na healthy and maganda sa kaniya, this movie could’ve been greater than it is if primo and george did not end up with each other and chose to grow separately, as individuals.

“matalino akong tao eh, pero pag dating sayo, ewan ko natatanga ako”this line is very relatable because no matter how well you know yourself, once na mahulog ka talaga sa taong gusto mo, wala zerow na ang katalinuhan mo. tanggal talaga ang angas mo bwhahahathis movie is about the relationship between two people with dreams who are tired of their relationship because they are no longer healthy for each other. primo is the best example of gwapong red flag (dapat iwasan) dahil masyado siya nag focus sa passion niya nakalimutan niya na meron din gustong marating si jo sa buhay niya and that is a big NO NO sa relationship. dapat both kayo nag ggrow sa passion and love niyo esp in different times kasi dito niyo mas mapag titibay yung relationship niyo. super sakit talaga yung part na “palibhasa kasi alam na alam mo….” it’s giving me n my past bf vibes, kasi super rupok ko rin pag dating sa hugs, kisses, and sorry nila kaya very ouchy yung scene na yon mwehehehe ^^would you recommend? def YES. esp kung gusto mo umiyak ng sobra :p jk, goods din naman yung kilig scenes kaya very recommendable shea ^______^Cinematography: 4/5 Story: 4.5/5Acting: 5/5Overall Rating: 9/10

i still think primo was just doing the bare minimum. acts of service is expected. and of course he was going to put his best foot forward. if he was going to come back, couldn’t he have done it without being an invasion of private space? boundaries ? if you were going to come back a better person, what do you have to show for it? yea so, your dad was sick and you took over all the responsibilities? as you should ! you gave up your unrealistic main hustle and put it aside for jobs that pay? as you should. you do your best to make up past wrongs? as you should . dude’s got a big head start by being decent-looking, musically-gifted, and good with words. girl knew she was smart. it’s too bad she gave in and didn’t let learning experiences be learning experiences.ok hm. maybe sure he deserved at least a chance to prove himself, but redemption came too quickly in my opinion. like, given the 7-year relationship that turned to crap, you’d think it’d take at least a year or two (preferably more) to really prove that you’ve changed, right ? and that you’re capable of conducting the relationship right this time ? then again, what do I know .oh also— kathryn bernardo slayed.

The movie "The Hows Of Us" defies preconceived assumptions of what romance is and instead leads us on an introspective excursion through the perilous waters of toxic relationships. This movie analysis challenges our preconceived ideas and compels us to face the unsettling reality that love can at times be…

I think we can see parts of ourselves on both George and Primo. May mga panahon na we are ready to give everything up for our partners, even our individual dreams, hoping that everything will work out in the end. After all, sino bang hindi gusto yung taong mahal nila hanggang sa dulo, sa dulo kung saan masaya na kayo?Minsan din tayong naging Primo; desperately chasing our passions in life kahit hindi pa praktikal. Well, art should be a liveable job naman technically, but we all know the reality rn. Still, we all had a little bit of Primo in ourselves believing na what if our passion can be our career at the same time. But mahirap din maging George at Primo. While Primo was chasing his dreams, he forgot that he has a partner to take care of and consider. Si George naman, kakaasikaso at asiste kay Primo, nakalimutan na yung mga sarili niyang pangarap. For me, this is what made the movie realistic.What I didn't like though was the fact na nagkabalikan sila and how they approached it. Para kasing nabura rin kung gaano ka-shitty yung ginawa ni Primo kay George over the course of their relationship. For me, dapat hindi sila nagbalikan talaga. Hence 4 stars. Kasi nga I rate for the vibes.

+ There is a hint of a better-written film in "The Hows of Us". The supposed premise of lovers continuing their emotionally halted journey in life together starts of strong. But with the number of expositions squattered throughout this film, mediocre characterizations, and underbaked romance, this film fails in deliverying a more memorable love-story. Its themes of redemption, growth, and forgiveness seems to be lop-sided in parts, and Kathryn Bernardo's George was poorly written—though Kathryn gave an ecstatic performance. Daniel Padilla as Primo, on the other hand, also gave enough nuance to make his character charming, and surprisingly earnest. Though much is to be desired in how this movie had told us its story, still, there is enough charm in here to win you over, even if it doesn't give you a lasting impression.

revisiting this movie, whether it’s watching the whole thing or just watching clips of it, always makes me cry very very ugly tears especially the scene where george finally gets to read the letter primo wrote for her 2 years later  this movie just portrays the heartbreak of meeting the right person at the right time yet circumstances and bad choices getting in the way so beautifully, it just hits you right to the corei’ve never personally experienced anything george and primo have, at least not to that degree, but they made me feel like i carried george’s burden and felt the guilt primo felt the entire time  these characters are just work of fiction yet they feel SO real, i honestly think they’re the most “human” characters ms. cathy g molina has created yet other than popoy and basha, which is already an impressive feat considering how one more chance and ESPECIALLY a second chance depicted the feeling of inadequacy in both marriage and your career.knowing that your s/o could do SO much better than you and it’s just agonizing to watch popoy slowly antagonize the woman he loves as he gets consumed by his own insecurities while basha’s doing her best to fix the damage that’s been donebut anyways to anyone who hasn’t watched the hows of us AND a second chance, 10/10 movies, both tear-jerkers, filipinos are the masters of romance-dramas idc if i’m biased, yes this review is just me singing praises for the director’s writing but

Strictly speaking, probably the best of the Kathniel movies. The one where both put in their most rounded performances, both charming and weighty when necessary. Beyond that, they're supported by much better material than in any of their other films. So much feels authentic and even the silliness of the core concept (dividing a house in half out of spite) feels grounded in a strong emotional reality that it passes by without much resistance from myself. There's also just a lot of interesting visual ideas going on here. Not all of them land perfectly, but I find myself appreciating all of them. In all her best work, Cathy Garcia-Molina has this very strong eye for divisions and framing and how that relates to the characters on screen. Obviously the divided house concept gives her a lot of chance to play with these ideas and generally speaking, they work to the film's benefit more than they detract.Where the film suffers is where it has to bow to the studio tentpole formula. Lengthy travel sequences get included in films like this as a means for the intended audience to live vicariously through the characters. Can't afford to go to The Netherlands? You can at least watch your favorite romcom team go instead. The Netherlands is a beautiful country but the entire subplot around Kathryn's brother and long lost father is just bloat that detracts from the heart of the movie. If this film had simply been contented being a romantic comedy (leaning towards drama), it might have been great. The addition of the family drama weighs it down dreadfully.That being said, it's a good movie. Too much of it works and those first two acts are some of the best I've seen from Filipino mainstream studio films. The crown jewel of the Kathniel canon, yet to be topped.

the first thirty minutes made me feel like i might need therapy after, but i’m so glad that the movie put me back together in the end. cathy garcia-molina challenges the conventional structure of a filipino romcom; instead of making sure the first half of the movie is lighthearted and lovey-dovey to get the audience invested before finally delivering the hard-hitting message it wants to send, she took the audiences aside from the opening shot and said: this is what’s going to happen, which is also just perfect for a movie called the hows of us.

just chose to review this to reveal my unpopular opinion on this that primo and george should not have ended up together by the end of this movie.don’t get me wrong, its a GREAT movie. i loved it. but realistically i imagined that they wouldn’t get back together yet they did. although yes, their happy ending was nice to see, and i personally enjoyed the movie all throughout, an alternative where they remain out of a romantic relationship would have been an interesting plot to see.

“What will be the consequences if I get back with you again? My world will stop again for you? How many years of my life will I waste again?(…) Look at me. Still trying to put my life back and regain everything I lost when you left me.”“And what makes that sorry different from all your sorrys before? I gave you almost seven years of my life, Primo. And in those seven years, it was just one time I told you I was tired. Only once did I ask myself if I could still fight. Only once did I have the courage to tell you how I felt. That I was hurting, that I was losing myself. Just one time, in the many times I could have given up, but I didn’t. But then you only needed one time to give up on us. To leave and not come back. I needed you to fight for us that night.”

darren and his subplot ruined itfirst half of the film >>> because the second half (the amsterdam arc, specifically) seemed like a different movie.if the amsterdam arc focused more on primo's side (as the film was told from george's point-of-view), rather than the search for george and yohan's father (darren's subplot), the film would be much better and the ending could be ‘more justified.’the only part of that arc that i like is the flower field scene. seeing the tulips was primo's and george's dream together. but things didn't go as planned. same as with life, you don't always get what you wished for but life will always find a way to give you something better or in their case, they became better persons despite the fact that they were unable to reach their dreams together as they had planned.speaking of the flower field scene, i truly wish they had given primo's side equal attention. i believe many viewers failed to notice his depression and suicidal phase. of course, it won't excuse him for what he did, but at least it shows that he didn't do it just because he wants to.overall, thou has lots of iconic lines that became part of philippine pop culture. also one of kathniel's best acting performances—daniel's quiet moments (internal) and kathryn's intense dialogues (external). if not for darren's irrelevant subplot, this will dethrone ‘she's dating the gangster’ as my favorite kathniel film. one of the highest grossing filipino films of all time, without a doubt.“Palibhasa kasi alam na alam mo kung paano ako kunin e. Isang ngiti, isang kanta, isang yakap, isang sorry, wala... Umiikot na ulit ‘yong mundo ko. Tangina, Primo! Matalino akong tao e. Pero pagdating sayo, ewan ko natatanga ako.”

Rewatching "The How's of Us," a film I once thought was close to perfect, I realize that my initial enjoyment for this film might have been misplaced.I used to think that this film was one of the more polished and masterfully written script, but my recent viewing revealed shortcomings that I just couldn't overlook.Beyond the cheesy dialogue, I found that many of the story points did not entirely make sense. The narrative, at times, felt forced, just to check off the boxes of what makes a tear-jerking romance drama film.This rewatch honestly left me disappointed, as I had expected more from a film I once held in high regard.

Heartbroken…just heartbroken. I hope the break-up news isn’t true. I truly hope this wasn’t their last movie together. Kathniel movies are the reason I went back to school to pursue film. Kathryn Bernardo and Daniel Padilla are inspirations to me. These movies mean so much to me. This couple means the world to me. I’ve been beyond devastated after hearing the heavy rumors of the break-up and it really seems to be true. My heart seriously aches so much…I cannot take it. With the new drama surrounding Kathniel, it can be said that “The Hows of Us” is a reflection of real life. Growing apart…making mistakes…the difficulty to forgive in adulthood…too many factors that limit our happiness…too many factors that change the way we love. The first time I watched this a couple of years ago, I was sobbing at the end of the movie. I was already a huge Kathniel fan before I watched this one, so that ending struck me so hard. Overall, the drama, cinematography and music meshes well together. I believe this is seriously a really beautiful film. I love this movie so much. I love Kathniel so much. I will always love Kathniel. As much as I would hope that they aren’t broken up, it’s not up to me to decide what’s best for them. They have helped me get through rough times. I believed in true love because of them. Sometimes, even the best relationships grow apart. Thank you Kathryn Bernardo. Thank you Daniel Padilla. Thank you for being the greatest love team of all time. I will always have a place in my heart for Kathniel. #KathnielForever

George is so Anino by UDD coded.“hindi tayo mapapakain ng passion na yan” that line literally hit me. i believe na if you really want to pursue your passion in arts or music, you shouldnt start a family or have a partner that wants to pursue something else. esp pag di naman stable pagkikita mo ng pera. its selfish. kasi di ka naman makakapag provide para sa kanila. ta mo tatay ko tangina musikero, eh wala ngang ambag sa buhay namin. physically there, but financially and emotionally absent. i really want to pursue arts since ayoko naman magka anak. pero may pamilya parin akong kailangang pakainin, ako inaasahang breadwinner, eh.pursuing your passion is truly a privilege, especially in this country with a fuck ass economy. i wish there were more opportunities for artists here in the philippines.tsaka if u wanna pursue your passion, kailangan yung partner mo wants the same future. eh si george at primo hindi talaga compatible. maganda nang maghiwalay na talaga sila kasi they want different futures. relationships should be a give and take. ano ba naiambag ni primo kay george nung una? he was selfish and doesnt know how to prioritize bigger things. he was being irrational. kahit sa bandmate nya, parang di nya pa kayang intindihin kabanda nyang gustong mag hanap ng trabaho para makapag provide sa pamilya nya. dapat nag jowa nalang si primo ng gusto rin mag pursue ng music eh, someone who wants to take the same path in life as him. and if i were george, naghanap nalang ako ng iba, o kaya just stayed single. basta wag nang ibalik yang primo na yan sa buhay ko. id just wish he changed for the better, id wish him all the best, and i hope to never hear about it.

Baka naaawa lang ako kay Kathryn ngayon kasi look at the date diba... Pero tbh binuhat nila silang lahat, kahit yung wig ni Daniel.Noong nakita ko ito nung 2018, over yung acting niya for me. Sa ikalawang panunuod, may mga mahahalagang performances si Kathryn dito. Mistulang siya ang nakaintindi sa paghihirap at ang naaangkop na kalakasan ni George upang makamit nya ang maayos na buhay.Naway ito na sana ang wakas ng pagdusa ng isang storya, ng pagbuo ng karakter sa pinoy romcoms, para lang mapunan ang negosyo ng love teams.Mas mahusay rin sana ang maiaambag sa kamalayan kung hindi na nagkatuluyan pa si Primo at George. Kay tagal rin niyang nagdusa sa makasariling pag-iisip ni Primo. Naway maging mas malaya pa ang mga ganitong kwento, hindi nahahanay sa "Prince Charming" si Maria Clara.Ang sabi ni George, pagod na sya sa grand gestures. Pagod na syang itigil yung mundo niya para kay Primo. Pero sa dulo, malalaking gestures nanaman, may pa-kanta kanta pa. Siyempre isasama niyo siya sa Amsterdam dahil siya nagbayad ng plane tickets. Walang respeto sa hiling ni George na lumayo na siya sa buhay niya. Dahil dito hindi nagsucceed ang pelikula.

"How can you give up so easily? How can you not find a reason to stay?"when i watched this film in the cinema for the first time, i cried. kathryn’s performance in this film was so good that my feelings were overflowing even after the movie. george, her character in the film is the type of person that “di madaling sumuko pero madaling sukuan” maybe that’s why i’ve always felt connected with her. she reminds me of myself, i guess that’s why it’s easy for me to sympathize her because I AM HER.i watched this movie again earlier this year and this time i was sobbing, i realized how much we’re alike and i hated that. ang bilis makuha, ang bilis sukuan, pero ang tagal makarealize. but i guess that’s just the way things goes ???? Anw i love this movie because it allows me to understand myself more. great storyline, great monologue, and great actors. OVERALL A GREAT FILO MOVIE.

no matter how many times i’ve watched this film, it never fails to make me cry (and inis at the same time!) > : )when i first watched this film, i was happy that they got back together in the end. i used to be a sucker for second chance tropes, so i was really hoping for them to be with each other again. but after rewatching it with all the knowledge i have today, i’ve had a lot of realizations about this film.primo’s actions to win her back (all the singing of umuwi ka na baby and bare minimum shits) & the letter he wrote do not validate every single thing that he made george feel. not all relationships deserve a comeback. no man is ever worth sacrificing your dream for. ‘isang beses lang ako nagtanong kung kaya ko pa ba. isang beses lang ako nagkaroon ng lakas ng loob para sabihin kung ano talaga yung nararamdaman ko, na nasasaktan nako, na nauubos nako. isang beses sa napakaraming beses na pwede akong sumuko pero di ko ginawa. pero isang beses lang din pala yung kailangan mo para sumuko, para umalis at hindi na bumalik. i needed you to fight for us that night because i was so tired fighting alone. yung kahit na sabihing kong umalis ka di ka aalis kasi kilala mo ko e. alam mo na nasabi ko lang yun kasi pagod ako pero mahal kita.’‘mahal din naman kita e. mahal parin naman kita’ ‘pero isang beses lang ako napagod iniwan mo na ako’ ‘how could you give up so easily? how did you not find a reason to stay’ ‘hinding hindi nako papayag na ubusin mo ako ulet. pagtigil ng ulan, paguwi ko, i want you gone. i will just get in touch with you kapag may kailangan ipasign kapag nabenta na yung bahay.’’alam ko na pagtila ng ulan dapat wala nako dito pero pwede bang huwag muna. i want to stay hanggang maibenta natin itong bahay.’Decode~Sabrina Carpenter‘you’re good at the falling not the staying there. you’re good at the giving too much then getting scared. you’re good at impersonating someone who cares and you had me for a minute there. but now I wonder why I let your confusion keep me up at night. i'm so tired. re-read every single undertone and I overanalyzed it, front, back, and beside it where else can we go? there's nothing left here to decode. done lookin' for signs in the gaps and the silence. It's just getting old, there's nothing left here to decode’‘intay lang. pasensya. until the sun rises again because it always does and when it does, at andyan ka parin nakabukas ka, you’re in for a lot of surprises. i may not have a reason to stay but i found a reason to come back.’my soul felt their testimony; i hope our soul would realign again and find reasons to forgive ourselves and each other when we’re all healed someday.if that someday never happens, i’m still grateful to have lived & learned through that imperfectly beautiful memory from that season‘blessed, blind, & broken’

Star Cinema have to stop producing repetitive and mediocre storyline for a romantic-drama/comedy film while using famous love teams to extract money from the audience especially to avid Kathniel fans. first, there are so many side stories such as the medical problem and the daddy issue which i find it unnecessary. i also want to point out the longingness of Darren to his father does not break the social construct of a traditional family and his acting makes it even annoying. second, the part where they go abroad seems forced, just to say that the movie is set in Amsterdam. it is irrelevant and a waste of production's money especially they can use provincial places in our country. third, the friends of Kathryn and Daniel are trying hard to be funny and have no significance to the character development of the protagonists even if Juan Miguel's role makes sense. fourth, the dialogues are too cheesy and have so many "hugot lines". fifth, the moral story of this film only taught audiences to be hopless romantic and to endure toxicity in order to save the relationship. the only breakthrough somehow is the absence of third party in the relationship. as well, Kathryn is too good as an actress to play another fragile female character.P.S.pangalawang beses ko na itong napanood at ganun pa rin, inis na inis pa rin talaga sa pekikulang ito. hindi na ulit ako mag-aaksaya ng dalawang oras para dito. mas pipiliin ko na lang ulit panoorin ang SDTG o HLG.

Since the breakup of power couple Kathryn Bernardo and Daniel Padilla, it seems like the best thing to do is to have a bittersweet marathon of all their films together. Although the teen romance genre is not typically not my cup of tea, the wife and I was able to watch at least one Kathniel film - which turned out to be their last - The Hows of Us (2018). Directed by the go-to filmmaker when it comes to romantic drama blockbusters, Cathy Garcia-Molina crafted something truly special that would resonate more to the love team's followers five years later.The film revolves around the central characters, George (Kathryn Bernardo) and Primo (Daniel Padilla), a couple whose relationship undergoes a tumultuous journey. The narrative ingeniously navigates through the highs and lows of their love story, exploring themes of commitment, dreams, and the inevitable challenges that life throws at them. The storytelling is compelling, keeping the audience engaged with a mix of heartwarming moments and gut-wrenching conflicts.By letting Bernardo and Padilla portray layered and maturing characters, this project breaks the conventional boundaries of the love team which became widely popular through their numerous rom-com TV serials. The commitment of the two young actors make this work as the story revolves around their truly relatable character arcs. Although the supporting cast could also use deeper exploration, the couple's natural chemistry is the beating heart of this film.It may have leaned more towards traditional romantic comedy/drama elements, but the film's success lies in its passionate execution, especially in terms of narrative exploration and character depth. The actors' real-life love story may have ended, but this film shall remain as a highlight of PH cinema.4.0 OUT OF 5STORY - 0.8EXECUTION - 0.8CHARACTERIZATION - 0.8ENTERTAINMENT VALUE - 0.8LASTING IMPACT - 0.8

Man, this Filipino movie was the boss for a whole year, raking in the moolah like crazy. And you know what? Totally deserved it. Firstly, Kathryn Bernardo ditched the teen idol tag and went full-blown actress – nailed it! There's this scene that screams dramatic superstar. Secondly, it's got this crazy formula that somehow clicks. Imagine all genres crashing like a traffic jam, but hey, it works like magic. Drama, comedy, romance – it's a whole package. Thirdly, it's like a crash course in Filipino values – family vibes, chasing dreams, and growing old with your ride-or-die. Can't get more Filipino than this. And let's not forget the killer screenplay and the jaw-dropping scenes of Amsterdam. Pure awesomeness!

*incoming word vomit, i will not reread this to check it the things i say make sense fjsdhfd*I watched this with a loud as-it-happens commentary on the decisions the characters make and I find myself acting like how people usually would advice their friends when they're with a /useless/ partner. I'd say "LEAVE HIM!" or "He isn't worth it!!!" or "There are other fish in the sea!!! Better fish!!"But I found myself silently relating a bit too much to Primo as I watched. I know how comforting it is that you know that there's someone rooting for you in what you feel are your darkest times. The only difference is that I live alone, therefore there was no one to see me when my 'functional' mask is off. In a way, it's good to not reveal that to anyone. But at the same, it may have been helpful to have someone like Jo around. (anyway, therapy helps!! you dont need a jowa to save you from yourself HAHA)My favorite part was when Jo opened up about how she felt about their breakup. The choice the scriptwriters made to have Jo angry at the fact that Primo left, rather than the fact that we was a piece of shit on the days leading to their breakup made it clear that she really was rooting for him. That her love for Primo was rooted in something deeper than the idea of what he could offer her. She was simply disappointed that he gave up on what they had when she started to break down as well. I definitely feel like their breakup was necessary. At that point, Jo's hope was the singular thread keeping that relationship intact, and hope can only take so much. So when it wasn't strong, the relationship had to unravel. And it was good that they both grew despite being apart.Did she have to go back to Primo? I don't know. If she didn't, i think it'll go to a "Past Lives" type of scenario when they meet each other again in the far far future, except with more contempt.On the subject of passion vs. practicality. I wish I knew the answer. I always always want people to choose passion. But I can't relate because I don't have passion. I simply have a drive to survive. So I go for practicality. But if I had passion like Primo, I understand why he acted the way he did. I always imagine that it must be nice to want something so strongly.Overall, I liked this movie. That red biochem book was one sturdy mf.

The acting performance of other people ESPECIALLY Darren is the reason why I couldn't rate this even higher. Anyway, I truly enjoyed this movie from start to finish, except when Darren was acting it was kind of cringe, to be honest. Music as well was so good. i have watched this movie for abt at least 5 times na LMFAO nakita k to sa cinema theatre mismo tas sobrang hagulgol k non EWAN KO BAlove and hate relationship ak with this movie kasi .. grabe magmahal si george, literal na kahit alam ko na ano mangyayari napapa- "ang tangaaa" pa rin ako. i dont think i can love someone to the point n i'd be willing to sacrifice my dreams for them—but maybe i do actually see myself sa state niya.  anyway, aware pala si primo sa mga actions niya eh; kung gaano siya naging gago, mapagmataas, tapos hindi marunong magpatalo.. kung gaano niya na pinapahirapan si george.. pero ang mas inintindi niya pa rin is yung kung anong gusto niya mangyari. hindi siya naging praktikal. nakakairita!!! alam ko may iba't iba tayong pinagdadaanan, may mga rough paths talaga sa buhay na mahirap lagpasan—pero self aware ka na. ikaw na mismo dapat uma-aksyon since may ibang tao na na involved.. pinaka-mahal mo pa sa buhay. kung hindi pa naglash out si kath, hindi pa niya sisimulan pagbabago niya. hindi pa siya aalis. nakakairita lang huhu mabuti nalang talaga naglash out si george noon tapos umalis na siya agad, kasi kung pinaglaban niya pa—wala lang sila patutunguhan. i believe tlga na may mga bagay talaga na kailangan mo matutuhan nang ikaw lang mag-isa. naniniwala ako sa may mga sitwasyon talaga na mas better if maggrow kayo seperately ng partner mo to open up a new perspective and more positive outlook sa buhay. hindi maganda panghawakan ang, "mahal ko eh" lalo na kung parehas na kayo nasasaktan, tapos halatang wala na talaga patutunguhan relasyon niyo. sabi nga nila.. kung kayo talaga, hahanap naman ng paraan tadhana para pagtagpuin uli kayo 'di ba?PERO KAIRITA LANG NA AYON TALAGA NANGYARI SAKANILA BWISETTT AYOKO NA MAGKABALIKAN SILA IK NA BUMALIK NA RAW YUNG DATING PRIMO PERO UGGHHH EWAN AYOKO LANG AYOKO AYOKO ANG TOXIC TLGA NI PRIMO STOPPPVPVLVLF

Nah man, sometimes toxicity can be too much. The movie tries to be genuine and tell a mature story not of first love, but trying to work through it, a story not often told. Primo and George want to be together but life and conflicting wants and personalities get in the way and people find themselves with the choice of staying or leaving; if the sacrifices were worth it. There’s a good movie here but its too cluttered with tropes and formula that it falls back to convention when it doesn’t have an idea for a scene.

Dyan ka lang. Dyan ka lang. Putek, yan ka nanaman eh! Palibhasa kasi alam na alam mo pano ako kunin eh. Isang ngiti, isang kanta, isang akap, isang sorry, wala umiikot na ulit yung mundo ko. Tangina, Primo. Matalino akong tao eh pero pagdating sayo ewan ko natatanga ako. Ano nanaman yung kapalit kapag binalikan nanaman kita? Titigil nanaman yung mundo ko para sayo? Ilang taon nanaman ng buhay ko yung sasayangin ko? Tangina alam mo ba si Miko? Ayun, magiging doctor na. Si Jessica? Happily married. Ako? Eto, sinusubukan pa rin bumangon para bawiin yung lahat nang nawala sakin nung iniwan mo ako. Jorge, I'm sorry. And what makes that sorry different from all your other sorries before? Halos pitong taon ng buhay ko binigay ko sayo, Primo. At sa pitong taon na 'yun, isang beses lang ako nagsabing pagod na ako. Isang beses lang ako nagtanong kung kaya ko pa ba. ive had a long-standing hatred for the hows of us. during the time of its release, it was hyped as a new, never before seen Kathniel film. groundbreaking. unstoppable. but it fell short of that for me, i was wholly disappointed and never wanted anything to do with the film ever again.after my initial viewing, i watched it two more times, once during the pandemic and again today. a lot of things have changed since then. i still don't like this movie, but i appreciate it more. Kathryn and Juan Miguel Severo carried hard during the first half of the movie. Absolutely banger monologues from them, quotable and cuts deep. I could never be George, but her bravery and fight inspires me, KAHIT NA SHE DESERVES BETTER THAN PRIMO!!! GIRL!! DAPAT DI MO NA SYA BINALIKAN!!

The Hows of UsOne of the best KathNiel films for me. It’s one of my feel-good Pinoy movies. I’ve seen it three times, and I just had some realizations about relationships.After rewatching it, I found myself reflecting again on how love can be so complicated. What makes it more meaningful is not just the love itself—but the presence of understanding, respect, and the choice to keep showing up for each other. It’s not always about grand gestures. Sometimes, it’s the quiet assurance, the willingness to stay, and the help you give one another when things get tough that matter the most.Love is not always filled with happy or funny days—there will be real struggles to face. But having a partner who truly gets you, who won’t make you feel like a burden even in your lowest moments—that’s something else. It’s a different kind of feeling when you’re sharing your life with someone who sees your mess and still chooses to stay. That kind of love feels safe. It feels like home.Living together isn’t easy. But what makes it bearable—even beautiful—is when both people make the choice to stay, to fight for the love they share. It should never be one-sided. A relationship thrives when both partners are making an effort. Communication, respect, loyalty, and understanding—these are the pillars that hold love together.Sharing a home means sharing lives, dreams, flaws, and even pain. It’s not just about romance; it’s about commitment. It’s choosing each other every day, even in the midst of exhaustion, misunderstandings, and storms. There will be moments of doubt, words spoken in anger, and days when love feels more like a burden than a comfort—but staying, especially during the storm, is what love truly asks of us.Before entering a lifelong commitment, ask yourself:Are you truly ready to live with someone through the calm and the chaos, the ease and the effort?Are you ready to love, not just in the good times—but especially in the hardest ones?Are you ready to choose them again and again, even when it’s no longer easy?The Hows of Us doesn’t just show us what love looks like—it shows us what it takes. And if you’re with the right person, every hardship turns into something beautiful.

tinanong kita 'ano paborito mong lokal na pelikula' sabi mo 'the hows of us' sabi ko 'ano yun'. pumamewang ka at umiling sa dismaya na para bang gusto mong tanggalin ang pagkapilipino ko. pinaupo mo ako at pinanood natin to. pagpupugay sayo at sa sikmura mong matibay.sabi mo, may iconic na eksena dito -- yung jeep scene na nagkakandarapa si primo sa hulas at lasing, at pilit siyang inaakay ni george kahit pa talikuran niya na yung exam na buong buhay niyang pinaghandaan. lumingon ka ng tingin kasi sabi mo nakalulungkot.pinanood ko ulit to ngayon kasi nakikipag kara-krus ako sa tulog at puyat. sabi mo, may isa pang iconic na eksena dito -- yung monologue ni george na 'pagod na pagod na pagod na ako'. pabiro mong sinabayan bigkasin ni kathryn linya por linya. doon ang pangalawang beses na pumihit ang sikmura ko.napagusapan natin, paano kung ako ang nasa lagay ni primo? babalikan mo ba ako? hindi pa tapos ang tanong pero nasagot mo na ng mariin na oo. sabi mo, hindi ko alam kung anong pambababoy sa pagkatao ang kaya mong gawin sa sarili mo para lang sa akin. hindi ako nakatulog noong gabing iyon dahil lumalampas sa pisngi ko ang ngiti. dumating tayo sa puntong kailangan nating maghiwalay, at hindi rin ako nakatulog noong gabing iyonpinanood ko ulit to ngayon kasi nakikipag kara-krus ako sa mga bukas kong sugat na hindi kumikirot hangga’t hindi tinitingnan. sa totoo lang, gusto ko lang makaramdam ulit.sabi mo tuwing Linggo, malulungkot ka dahil sa atin nakalaan ang araw na iyon at doon mo ako maaalala. tuwing Linggo nagdarasal ako na daanan ka ng matinding kalungkutan at magpapamisa ako sa Quiapo kapag nangyari iyon. tuwing Lunes, hinihintay ko mag Linggo. pero hindi dapat ganoon dahil napupuno ang mga araw ko ng mga ikaw. sayo na tong pelikula mo tangina ka. okei naman 4/5 hehe

The How’s of Us captures the kind of relationship that feels real — messy, painful, and full of the quiet moments that make love worth holding onto. Kathryn Bernardo and Daniel Padilla deliver their best performances yet; their chemistry is raw and mature, showing what it really means to love someone through the highs and lows.It’s not just a romance — it’s a reflection on growing up, on chasing dreams without losing yourself (or the person you love along the way). The emotions are so grounded that you can’t help but see a bit of yourself in Primo and George.Some scenes hurt to watch, but in the best way possible. The How’s of Us reminds us that sometimes love isn’t about staying the same — it’s about growing together, even when it hurts.

yung sabi nya dati siya na ang lifetime cake supplier ni george kaya kahit wala na silang perang pambayad ng kuryente at tubig, ginawan pa rin nya ng paraan at nanghingi kung saan saan ....yall this broke man propaganda is getting to me! or siguro yung fact lang na para sa akin, in a way, love is not about what u do for your s/o kapag super filled ang pockets mo, kasi most of us can give when we have so much. but paano kung walang wala na tayo? i think it shows what you’re really willing to do. proves that you can go to the ends of the earth for them. i don’t tolerate unemployed men who live off by their partners esp na gustong mag med ni george, at siya lang ang nagpapaka hirap na magbayad ng bills nila. ito na ata talaga ang nagpatotoo ng sinasabi nilang “love is an illness to a woman with goals.” pero it doesn’t have to be. it’s just that george was always to giving everything up for primo, even if it meant having to put a pause on her own life. sadly, primo wasn't. he couldn’t give up his own dreams for her kahit na nagkanda kuba kuba na si george kakatrabaho matustusan lang ang pangangailangan nila. i remember watching this in the cinemas when I was in 8th grade and i can say that it is still just as funny and as hurtful as i've first watched this. looking back, taon taon ko ata to naiisipan irewatch and i do it for a reason!!i miss kathniel :(

For the couples drowning in love and survival.Primo (Daniel Padilla) and George (Kathryn Bernardo) are the embodiment of “mahal pero pagod na.” Love alone isn’t enough when dreams and pride collide. The line that cut deepest: “Sawang-sawa na kong magmahal sa ’yo.” It’s cruel, yet so honest. This movie is about the wear and tear of long-term love—the kind that tests your patience and your will to stay.Pero the most painful line for me was George saying:“I needed you to fight for us that night, because I was tired fighting alone.”Ang bigat. Kasi love is supposed to be shared—hindi pwedeng isa lang ang lumalaban. When she said that, it showed how empty and one-sided their relationship had become.For me, George shouldn’t have gone back to Primo. The braver, healthier ending would’ve been choosing herself. Love can’t survive kung ikaw lang ang may hawak ng lubid habang yung isa paulit-ulit na bibitaw. Walking away doesn’t erase the love, but it proves na self-respect and peace are worth more than a history that keeps breaking you. George deserved someone who would fight with her, not leave her fighting alone.

Due to I can't find again the movie I was supposed to watch again today because I want to watch movies that was never heard of or already been buried too deep, I decided to use my sister payment to that hideous app (Netflix). Because in years of subscribing to that app, the ones I've always wanted to watch are not in this app and no, I'm not gonna risk my time and waste it by watching their own horrible production films. Crazy that they managed to change their price when they couldn't even give me a quality… you're really just enjoying this app if you're still a koreaboo (at this time), if you're also a Filipino media enjoyer or an Adam Sandler movie enjoyer and thankfully, I'm not one of either of the three. So yeah that app is just being logged in our TV but no one is actually using it unless we have friends coming over. Totally a waste of money I think but my mother is enjoying it I guess…I literally just said what the hell. If I can't always find the movie I wanted to watch then I'm just wasting the consecutive suspensions of classes so yeah fawk it, I will just whatever's on the table. Well, it's not exactly in the table because I still searched in this app what hideous film I would waste my time and something ticks in me that I should watch a Kathniel movie because why not? And then I remembered that this is one of their films that I still haven't watched but knowing how impactful it is to this country, maybe this is the time. You know, I have always been not a fan of Kathniel. I mean, I don't hate them so much like it's not about them. I just don't invest in Filipino media so much because it hurts to admit but we are really bad at everything in here from the movies, televisions, music and everything so that's why I stopped investing in that side. But #trust that whenever there's an issue lying around of course, I'll be there. I'm sorry I'm just a normal Filipino who loves gossip and nosing my butt in other's lives. I remembered back when I was Grade 12, we had a roleplay activity that we had to do in front of us and we had some movie references that we could copy and this movie is one of them. First is, the teacher showed us the scene of Kathryn’s crying in the rain scene and lol I literally take a picture of that and posted in my story and said that this woman really cannot act and all my classmates saw it and laugh about it so that's why one of the best known of me is being a hater of Kathryn Bernardo. And hey! I'm sorry if I was called that . I never wanted it and I never intended to. I was just being honest and I told you that I still haven't watched this movie so watching that scene out of context really brought the wrong and early judgment of me. But this is why I'm changed now that I watched this film. I don't know if I can do it since I still haven't watched all of her films but based on the films that I watched, this really might be her best performance yet. But I wouldn't say the best… I mean she definitely improved maybe because her roles have always been the same for years and this role back then might be the most mature one yet and I really see that. Her character here is one of the best ones she played and one of the best written yet considering this was written by the same director who always gives the same quality of characters for me. There's an attempt here that I really appreciate but I still hope that it could've been more just like the rest of all people. I need her to be bolder, stronger and better. But it's enough I guess if this is actually the story they wanted to portray since the start.I know one thing that we can agree on liking this. The YEARNING. It might be the best love approach that can be shown in the media. And it's rare for me to watch a Filipino movie that the yearning was done right. This is the highlight of the film for me. You can really feel the couple’s chemistry in this movie and I understand and see that considering this is one of this couple's peak years. I was smiling, giggling like a girl and entertained. But it's also annoying to watch now. I think this is really one of the films that can be watched back then but cannot be now. This is their best role yet if we're gonna base it on the chemistry like they're literally just being a couple in here but with a plot. And it's making me mad that they can't be like that off camera now because this man played his role a little too well. Fawk this guy to death like I wish he never finds a stardom again after what he did to their relationship. Everybody is worshiping your relationship like it was a major holiday whenever you're doing something. But you are also the one who ruined it. Men really are ruining everything. Straight men specifically. I like Primo in this movie but I can't bear to see that it was being played by this man.There's still some bad acting in this movie that of course, will never go in Filipino movies. And yes that was you Darren. Question, why is he here?? Seriously. Ah. I remember now. I live in the Philippines where everybody can be anything just because they can! Like just go back being a singer or do something but just please don't ever step foot in the acting industry. I think the gay best friend is doing the bare minimum too, like a little bit overacting for me because I'm a gay bestfriend too or maybe I just didn't like his character in here. I mean it's obvious to me in the start how he didn't want her to be happy and I wouldn't do that to my girl besties. It's not right for me to see Jean Garcia not acting an antagonist because she really solidified her career in those roles. Like why do I kinda need her to slap Primo in here?? The thing is, I wouldn't hate this movie so much because my friend right literally acted like George who is always coming back to her ex and I know a lot of y’all are being hypocrites too because I'm sure as hell you would do the same as George or far worse. I mean that's literally one of the reasons why we don't have proper birth control in our country, right? But I'm glad the quote of “Love is not enough” is being taken seriously now and being the base or references of every couple now because it's always been the right statement for every couple. The ending was a lackluster for me. I mean I literally have to go through their makeup which is too long for me. It is too long just to end it with George seeing Primo’s letter that he hid in the music record which is I still think why'd he have to hide in there. I don't think the finding father plot was out of place but if the results are like that then the whole Amsterdam scene should've been the time where the finally made up and spent each other's lives again together and better. In short, the yearning was too good just to have unsatisfying results. I might say that this was a good choice of movie. This is definitely Kathryn's one of best roles and I hope she continues to improve and I will continue to support her career and wish the downfall of that man on the other hand. I hope she's happy and is eating a good meal everyday. Daniel Padilla, you will burn in hell. I will make sure of that.B Tier2018 Ranked

It’s the first time I’m writing a review for a romance movie, although I do actually watch some. This one hits different when it comes to love. The way they portrayed the characters, it’s just bitter yet sweet. My favorite scene is when they were outside during the rain—Joy’s dialogue is what you’d feel the most. She was giving her pieces one by one to her love, so she was left with nothing in the end. Despite that, Primo actually received nothing, because people do not get the ability to receive that. Only to suck it up. Both of them were drained and sad and lost.For Primo’s side, he was really a good man. Although for the scenes that he was facing bad things, he didn’t deserve Joy nor anything from her. I pitied him. But it doesn’t mean that Joy should feel that, too. That’s why when they got away from each other, it was probably to find themselves. That’s how I liked The Hows of Us. The ending is up to you, actually. Whether they ended up together or just friends. The only thing I hope is for them to be happy.

super, super, super gago ni primo (and i really did hate how this film tried to justify yung pagiging pabuhat niya sa buhay ni jo) but unfortunately, i can't wholeheartedly say that i disliked this.it was very quirky and fun naman in its concept! even though kathryn literally carried the whole thing by her back, i found it charming and could see why this appealed to the local masses. i love how jo's character was fleshed out and portrayed, and i loved every moment that she stood for her own ground. primo, on the other hand... well, i just don't see why people like him and why the ending with him had to be that. sure, he redeemed himself but it's like. i found it so stupid and manipulative personally (literal na throughout the whole movie i felt like pinaglalaruan lang ako ng ulol) which is why !!! a star is deducted. but if we disregard all that, then maybe this film did have an impact on me... The Hows of Us isn’t just a love story — it’s a crash course in growing up together and growing apart. Kathryn and Daniel turn Primo and George into that couple you root for even when they’re exhausting you, because the love feels real, messy, and lived-in. It’s the kind of heartbreak that stings extra, because it reminds you of the fights you’ve had, the dreams you’ve shelved, and the person you once promised forever to.The Hows of Us: loving you is easy, living with you is the plot twist.

It made me realize na love isn’t always all flowers and kilig. It’s not just about the good stuff. You also love their moods, their flaws, the ugly sides. You love the whole person, hindi lang ‘yong version nila when everything’s okay. But at the same time, love isn’t always enough. Especially when you’re starting to lose yourself in the process. Like, what’s the point if you’re always putting them first, tapos ikaw, you forget your own needs, your goals, your peace just to keep them? That’s not love. That’s self-abandonment. And sometimes, the most loving thing you can do is to choose you. Kahit masakit. Kahit mahal mo pa. :]

Definitely the realest confrontation between ex-lovers I’ve ever seen in a movie."How could you give up so easily? How could you not find a reason to stay?"I could really feel Kath’s emotions in that scene— the anger, the exhaustion, the disappointment, and the pain. The kind of pain that doesn’t just come from being left behind, but from knowing you weren’t even fought for. Like you were the only one still willing to hold on.Because why is it so easy for them to leave, to let go, to walk away while you’re still here, stuck with all the “what ifs,” still clinging to a story that ended too soon?

loved the delivery of the exposition, lalo na yung direct parallels from when they were still together to 2 years after the breakup. very similar in style sa starting over again, which is fave ko. what i really loved about this movie aside from the characters is the pacing, manner of narration, and the way it portrayed how jo lost her resolve and resistance against primo, kasi relatable pa rin kahit na nakakainis at nakakairita na yung katangahan ni george. matalino naman talaga siya pero i think ang problema sa kanya is masyado niyang sineryoso ang feelings na nagresurface noong bumalik si primo, in short, masyadong marupok! remember, hindi lahat ng emotion na nararamdaman natin sa katawan ay reliable. we should never make decisions based on our feelings alone, dapat may balance between objective fact/reality and what we feel. totoo na mahal pa rin ni george si primo, pero at the same time, malaki ang kasalanan at trauma na nacause ni primo kay george, kaya hindi dapat nagpadala si george sa feelings niya at bumalik kay primo. what they need from each other is sincere apology with accountability and closure, hindi comeback. hindi deserve ni george na magstay sa taong katulad ni primo. george deserves so much better, and not the "better" that primo has to offer.

This one hurt differently— not in the loud, heart-wrenching way some love stories do, but in that slow ache of staying too long. Of loving past the expiration date. Of fighting for something that no longer knows how to fight back.George and Primo weren’t star-crossed or tragic in the classic sense. They were real. Exhausted. Stubborn. Still soft for each other beneath the bruises of all those unfinished conversations. And maybe that’s what made it worse— their love didn’t end with anger. It ended with the weight of trying. Again and again. And again.I didn’t cry at the big scenes.I cried when she stared at him from across the room and didn’t know what to say.I cried at the way he said “pangarap” like it used to mean us, and now it only means me.The film didn’t scream. It simmered. It dragged me through the quiet cruelties of outgrowing someone you still care for. It reminded me of the version of myself I stayed with too long. The promises we tried to keep when our hearts had already started packing.And yet— somehow— it wasn’t hopeless. It was sad, but not bitter. That’s harder to write. That’s harder to feel.It whispered,“You loved. You outgrew. You survived.”And sometimes, that’s the most devastating line of all.This film felt like a letter you never sent. The kind that sits in your notes app. Half bitter. Half soft. Fully human.If you’ve ever loved someone deeply and had to choose yourself anyway— this one will sting. Gently.

"The Hows of Us” isn’t your usual dreamy, rom-com na may happy-ever-after agad. It digs deeper—sobrang sakit, sobrang real. This movie shows na kahit gaano kalalim ang pagmamahalan n'yo, minsan, hindi ‘yon sapat para manatili. George and Primo’s story hits hard kasi hindi ito tungkol sa how they met, kundi sa how they survived... or didn’t.Pero ang ganda ng mga songs dito ha, damang-dama.It’s about love that starts with so much fire but slowly fades into frustration, broken dreams, and too many “sorrys.” Yung mga “I love you” na eventually napalitan ng “Pagod na ako.” Yung tipong mahal mo pa, pero pagod ka na. At ‘di ba, that’s one of the worst kinds of heartbreak?Kathryn nailed it with her raw, painful delivery—lalo na sa scene kung saan sinasabi niya kung gaano siya naghihintay na lumaban si Primo."How did you not found a reason stay?""And what makes your sorry different from all your sorry before?"Ang ganda rin ng message ng film: Love isn’t always magical. Minsan, love is staying, choosing, and fixing—kahit ang hirap-hirap na.Tho nawala lang yung gana ko kasi bakit ganon na lang uli naging soft si George kay Primo? 7 years siyang nawala and parang tinanggap niya lang uli as if 1 week silang nag-away? Hindi man lang pinahirapan yang si Primo kahit na gusto niya pa, sinubukan niya man lang sana na i-challenge para mas masukat kung totoo na ba talaga yung pinapakita niya. Pero okay bumawi naman siya sa pagtulong kay Yohan.

this movie had a lot of potential to resonate even more however it stays as potential.it started off so strong until it expands through unnecessary stuff when the messages and themes could easily be done in a more cohesive way. it strayed off from being grounded to the typical romcom filo film which robbed it from its potential to be even more hard-hitting.Kathryn was a definite highlight, portraying the convoluted yet true experience of exhaustion and frustration but somehow, still having feelings of love.the overall message of the movie is definitely something you don’t take at face value. it requires an understanding of the different complex parts of ourselves and our emotions that play into a relationship working out or not.

I don't know what's up with Star Cinema and their liking sa mga ganitong genre pero they really need to stop.

both sides were valid for me …. lahat tayo ay napapagod pero we are either made from it or broken from it. si george ang isang halimbawa ng mga taong ieendure talaga ang lahat-lahat para sa pag-ibig. it was supposedly her desirable trait until she was broken from it bit by bit. sa sobrang pag-uuna niya sa mga taong mahal niya, nakalimutan niyang magtira para sa sarili niya  inuna niya ang pag-ibig kaysa sa pangaraphabang si primo naman … inuna ang pangarap bago ang pag-ibig, at ayon ang ikinasira niya. it does hurt when your passion is not appreciated enough, at alam niyang nahihirapan din si george sakanya. it never meant he loved george less, he was just passion-driven, and that is never wrong. ang mali lang niya ay nagkulang siya para ipakita yon kay georgeeither way — love will either blind or wake us from reality. we do things out of spite for love even in the least expected times that we will. ibubuhos ang buong kaluluwa at pagkatao para sa taong mahal natin — but too much of something never ends well.

“in order to win a war, you have to stay together.”that line hit hard because love isn’t about avoiding conflict, it’s about choosing to stay even when it’s hard. the hows of us reminded me that real love isn’t always romantic or dreamy. it’s work, patience, and showing up even when it hurts.what stood out to me was kung gano kadali sumuko when things get painful, and how rare it is to hold on. but sometimes, like the film said, all we need is a little patience.some relationships need space to grow. others grow best together. and figuring that out is part of the journey.i learned that love means constantly choosing each other. not just when it’s easy, but especially when it’s not. facing the problem together, talking, being tired together, resting when needed. that’s what makes love last.i hope one day i find a kind of love that feels safe, honest, and patient. and i hope that kind of love finds me, too.

Not a single movie in my life has ever made me cry so much. legit. it's such a real story. yes, it may have covered cliched topics on relationship (aka falling for your exes blah blah blah), pero ang simple talaga ng ideya, and yet it manifests the struggles people face within a relationship, and it holds so many lessons to learn from. i also love how they promoted the house to the tita. how everything from that house has memories, how the house has their history. the tape on the floors and walls, the divided kitched and fridge, the couch. the couch where they built their dreams and hopes for the future. so much sentiment in everything they once had, and they gave it all away. but the war is over. the battle has been won. "Just ride the tide, until the sun rises again. Because it always does.”

This film was okay. Cathy's movies just really have a track record for being cheater and manipulator apologists. Darren's character is one of the flaws. Not sure if it was his execution or bad writing but his 17 yo character acts like a 9 yo on some occasions, which I find weird. George's friends are lowkey annoying too. The plot was all over the place- lots of things don't make sense (eg. tita lola entrusting Primo to the house, the Amsterdam storyline, etc.)The acting, however, was very powerful here. Kathryn's delivery was very raw. Daniel improved so much. He's not that on par with Kath still imo, but not too bad.

The House of Us is a quiet kind of heartbreak. It tells the story of two people who once shared the same dreams but slowly drifted apart. It is not the loud kind of love. It is the kind that stays even when things get hard. The kind that gets tired but never fully disappears.It shows how love can be full of promises, but life can still find a way to test every one of them. They love each other deeply, but they are no longer the same people who started the journey. And that is what hurts the most. Watching two people hold on while slowly breaking inside.The film reminds you of the love you once believed would last forever. The kind that felt like home. And when that love starts to fall apart, it does not shatter all at once. It fades. Quietly. Painfully. And yet, in all the breaking, there is still hope. Hope that love, when chosen again, can still heal. Even if nothing is the same anymore.

The Hows of Us felt to me like a simple, yet not shallow romantic melodrama. It sits somewhere between emotional depth and surface-level storytelling, focusing on a couple navigating love, breakup, and reconciliation.The screenplay was simple but had an almost episodic feel to it, i wasn't annoyed by it though and actually enjoyed some of the sequences as well.The humor was a mix of slightly cringeworthy moments and genuinely funny ones.The romance, both in its joyful and sorrowful moments had a mixture of both melodramatic, over the top yet funny moments, dialogues that felt like lied between borderline cringe and genuinely touching and effectively playful at times as well The chemistry between the leads stood out. I liked them as a couple, and both gave good performances, the lady, maybe, more than the male lead, since the writers did give her a bit more importance with backstory, depth and dialogues and so the actress had more to work with in here.The Amsterdam scene was the only one that felt a little unnecessary. Even though it added depth to both characters, especially George and featured the important flower field moments, and the detailing regarding her wish to watch tulips and all, there was still something about it that felt out of place. And yeah, i guess, it was the location change that might've made me think that way.

It’s a movie that you would want to watch over and over again.

This movie isn't just a "movie" it's an emotional rollercoaster. The film portrays the struggles of a long-term relationship facing an unexpected Crisis, moment of heartbreak,the unspoken tension, and the agonizing process of trying to rebuild the trust this movie makes you feel everything is real. It shows that being in a relationship is not all about "love", "spark", and "kilig" There are times that you'll have a fight and you'll just throw hurtful words at each other. Not all the time it's all about love, but it's all about sacrifices and devotion . You'll sacrifice everything for your loved ones, until you get drained,tired, and until you don't have anything to yourself anymore because you give them all. "The Hows of us" hit me hard when the raining scene started. I found myself completely absorbed in the character's struggles.

This movie isn't just a "movie" it's an emotional rollercoaster. The film portrays the struggles of a long-term relationship facing an unexpected Crisis, moment of heartbreak,the unspoken tension, and the agonizing process of trying to rebuild the trust this movie makes you feel everything is real. It shows that being in a relationship is not all about "love", "spark", and "kilig" There are times that you'll have a fight and you'll just throw hurtful words at each other. Not all the time it's all about love, but it's all about sacrifices and devotion . You'll sacrifice everything for your loved ones, until you get drained,tired, and until you don't have anything to yourself anymore because you give them all. "The Hows of us" hit me hard when the raining scene started. I found myself completely absorbed in the character's struggles, almost thinking that i’m part of it, the way they delivered everything it will make you realize that everyone’s in relationship experience all the struggles and burden.

Happy birthday Jo. Pasensya ka na kung 'to munang lumang record ni tita lola regalo ko sayo ha. Wala e. Wala pa. I know that lately I've been falling short of the man I promised I'd become. The man you deserve. Nakikita ko kung paano ka nahihirapan Jo. It crushes me. Kasi ang totoo, hindi ko na rin talaga alam kung paano e. Paano pa ba ako makakabangon. Paano ko ba matutupad mga pangarap natin. Paano ko pa ba matutupad…
tangina talaga ni primo

"I needed for you to fight for us that night because I was so tired fighting alone"Napa what if nalang talaga ako sa part na what if George read the letter in the vinyl record on her birthday? Would it change the trajectory of their story? Would it be enough to convince her to continue fighting even though she's drained and exhausted of everything? Would they still be together? And if she did, would it be worth it? But I also realized that it's good narin na hindi niya nabasa kasi after ending things with Primo, she had a better life. Kahit mahirap at masakit para sa kanya. This made me realize that sometimes you have to lose what you thought you needed in order to make space for what you truly deserve.Maraming pagkakamali si Primo, and of course may mali din si George. Lalo na sa part na she has all the reason to walk away and leave Primo before, but she just can't kasi sobrang mahal niya. It's not her fault for loving someone at their worst. Pero sana hindi niya kinalimutan yung self worth niya. Nakakahinayang lang talaga yung years na nasayang niya taking care of Primo only to end up sacrificing her opportunity to become a doctor This reminded me that you can love someone with all your heart but do not forget your own worth in the process. You don't have to shrink your worth just to fit someone else's comfort or expectation. Girl, you do you! Ang pinaka takeaway ko sa movie na 'to is to choose wisely between love and life's priorities. Know when to stop and walk away kasi walking away is not just about giving up on love, but choosing to honor your worth and the future you've worked so hard for. Also, hindi ibigsabihin na may natapos ay tapos na. The end is just the beginning of something better. To my girlies, I hope we won't experience what George had gone through. I hope we don't meet the Primo in our life that will make us choose between love or career. I hope we get the love that we truly deserve.

i don't like dj but jesus christ this (under sdtg) will always be my fav kath(niel) movie. i can still remember watching this when i was 14, crying at the cinema just because the movie felt sad. but now, after 5 years later; i found myself crying for a different reason. maybe it's bcs i experienced living in together that's why this is so special to me now. i find it so comforting how they find a way back to each other. primo wouldn't be the best choice to be a partner of course, but the way that george made him who he was at the present— the way he changed for the better. yes it would've been nice if it happened when they were together. but as they say, you don't realize how much you love someone until they're gone.i never realized that i would pick up so much from this movie now that i'm rewatching it in another age. both george and primo are flawed. and it may not be the most realistic ending that they'd still end up together; but at the end of the day, maybe if it's really meant to be then it will be¿i now wonder how i'd view this movie if i watch it in another 5 years, maybe it'll change.

She should've left his ass. Don't get me wrong, I understand both sides, but they were simply not meant for each other. What Primo put Jo through isn't something a mere letter can redeem, nor does it erase their incompatibility. Sayang, the film had such an interesting message about love as a responsibility—an active choice, not just a passive state—and how career differences shape adult relationships. But it wastes all of that potential by leaning into the overused 'miscommunication' trope and forcing a fairytale ending. Just another rom-com. We are soooo tired.

Watching this was an experience that truly stayed with me  I remember settling in for the film, not knowing that it would stir up so many emotions and memories of my own ups and downs in love. From the very first scene, the realistic portrayal of a relationship’s joys and struggles pulled me into a world that felt both familiar and profoundly moving.What struck me most was the film’s honest depiction of the challenges that come with deep, enduring love. The story isn’t about a perfect romance; it’s about real-life conflicts, sacrifices, and the bittersweet moments that define our relationships. I found myself recalling personal experiences times when love meant both elation and heartache and this connection made the film’s narrative all the more powerful.The chemistry between KathNiel was undeniable  Their performances felt genuine, conveying the vulnerability and intensity of their characters’ journey. I was particularly touched by how their expressions and subtle gestures spoke volumes, often more than the dialogue could. It’s rare for a film to make you feel as if you’re living the characters’ experiences alongside them, and that’s something I felt deeply throughout the movie (I just want to mention this so bad ) Beyond the romance and drama, this prompted me to reflect on my own relationships. There were moments of quiet introspection scenes where the characters faced their inner battles and external pressures that resonated with me personally. The film’s pacing allowed for these moments to sink in, making the experience both cathartic and thought provoking.The cinematography was evident in every frame  The visual storytelling, from intimate close ups to sweeping shots of the setting, created an immersive atmosphere. I appreciated how the film balanced its dramatic highs with more tender, reflective scenes, offering a nuanced look at what it means to love and to let go.In the end I just want to say, AY LAB IT SO MUCH!  The Hows of Us isn’t just a love story it’s a reminder of the complexities and realities of life. It left me with a sense of nostalgia and a deeper appreciation for the unpredictable nature of relationships. (which I don’t feel much anymore ‘cuz I just expect the worse) For anyone who has ever loved, lost, or simply wondered about the true nature of connection, THIS FILM IS DEF A MUST WATCH!
